"This punch is so good!" my cousin @PERSON1 said. "I know that's why I had my mom make it." "Do you wanna hear a joke?" "Sure." @PERSON1 said. "Once upon a time, there was a kid named butt itches. He was really sick and one day died. His mom cried to the doctor, 'Oh, my poor butt itches!'" "And guess what, do you wanna know what the doctor said?" "What?" asked @PERSON1. "Itch it!" @PERSON1 had just taken a drink of punch when I said that. She spit the punch out of her mouth while laughing, and it got all over me. Usually when someone spits or spills something on you, you get mad. But I started cracking up laughing, and so did she. "Oh my gosh! That's so gross." But we could not stop laughing. The joke was not that funny; it was the punch all over me and the kitchen. We laughed for at least fifteen minutes before even realizing that both our moms were standing in the kitchen. They were just staring at us, wondering what in the world had happened. You would think that getting punch spitted at your face on your @CAPS2 would make you mad. This is why laughter makes ordinary days special. In my case, laughter was the shortest distance between @PERSON1 and I. It would have to be short for her to get that much punch on me. Laughter made this @CAPS2 extra special because I will never forget my twelfth @CAPS2.

What on earth, @CAPS1 @CAPS1 @CAPS1, and now even @CAPS2 (such a strange situation @CAPS3 @CAPS4 @CAPS5). Laughter! Some say it is the best medicine. It can truly brighten a cloudy day, cure a case of the blues, and even soothe a breaking heart. On the other hand, a simple snicker or soft giggle can break a heart too! I have had first - hand experience listening to goofy squeals being thrown my way, not because I told a witty joke, but simply for sitting in my @NUM1 grade classroom and becoming the butt of my peers' jokes. Before I go on with this story, there are a few things you must know. Let alone that all @NUM1 graders have a common, undeniable urge to bring people down so they can build themselves up. I was a @NUM1 grader whose weight had reached the point at which my doctors were telling me, "You should look into a weight - loss program." This news alone was crushing my self - esteem, and my classmates' laughter soon brought me to tears. I can recall a particular incident, perhaps one of the worst. I was on the bus and almost home when @NUM4 girls who I thought were my friends started laughing. Little did I know it was me they were laughing at, so I joined in what I thought, and what seemed to be some innocent giggling. Suddenly they stopped, looked at me, started whispering to each other, then one of the girls blurted out between chuckles, "You look like a beached whale!" She said this so loudly that the whole bus heard and immediately burst into side - splitting laughter. I walked down the same street I walked down every day where the bus dropped me off. That day it seemed more gloomy than ever before. This is the day I decided I was never going to set foot on the bus again! It is encounters with laughter like this that broke my heart but also gave me a strong motivation towards losing weight and regaining confidence. Days, weeks, months, even years have passed since that day in the @NUM1 grade. I'm @NUM6 pounds lighter, a varsity cheerleader, and proud of who I am. The tables have turned for me in many ways. I am no longer the person who gets laughed at because of my weight, but sometimes I catch myself mindlessly cracking a joke or two at someone else's expense. I can recall just the other day, I was with my best friend at the mall. She spotted this girl who was overweight and immediately started giggling and elbowing me in the side, trying to draw my attention to her like she was some freak show. When I saw the girl, my first reaction was a hideous laugh, but just as soon as I did so, I felt the same pain I felt when that bus full of my peers laughed at me. I immediately stopped, realizing the pain my laughter could have brought her. My self, I am a very funny person and will do just about anything for a laugh. But when it comes to laughing at people and hurting their feelings, this is where I draw the line because I know how it feels to be in their position, and I hope that my story helps open the eyes of you and others to the harmful effects some laughter can have. So go ahead and laugh, laugh, laugh, @CAPS1 @CAPS1 @CAPS1, and even @CAPS2, just not at the expense of another person's feelings.

Laughter is a big part of my life, and I firmly believe that we have to have laughter in a good and healthy relationship. This is a true story about laughter and its effects on my life. Laughter is a wonderful thing for your body, mind, and soul. It can lighten up a gloomy mood when I'm feeling down. I'm glad to say I have lots of relationships, many of which are blessed with laughter. My mother and I have an incredibly close relationship. Almost any time we're in the same room, there is bound to be laughter. My mother and I laugh all the time, over the silliest of things. We laugh just for the sake of laughing, and most of the time, we don't even know what we're laughing at. She has this amazing ability to make me laugh at the most ridiculous things. I'm also pretty sure she's the only person who can get me to spit my drink all over the dashboard just because of a silly face she made. My mother isn't the only one I can have a great time with. I remember a conversation I had with a good friend of mine. It was about the way people laughed. I told her about how I had noticed that people usually laughed in different vowel sounds, like a, e, and o. It seemed really odd to me that I had only ever heard people laughing in those vowels and not I and u. She thought the same thing I did, so we came up with this fun idea to laugh in the vowels I and u. Of course, people were too busy with their own lives to notice us laughing oddly, but it was a lot of fun all the same. You never really realize how hard it is to not laugh until the occasion is upon you. My mom and I were at my aunt's house, trying desperately not to laugh. We had all decided to do a facial cleansing mask we had seen on a popular TV show. The mask itself was made out of whisked egg whites and toilet paper. You dip the toilet paper in the egg whites and plaster it all over your face. You have to wait at least fifteen minutes or until it's completely dry before you can take it off; otherwise, it doesn't work. The three of us did as the instructions told us, but were dismayed when we saw the final results of our efforts. We weren't upset because we looked repulsive; we were upset because we all looked like a bunch of crazy ladies, and we found it extremely difficult not to burst into laughter. The sight of my mother and aunt was so ridiculously funny that I had to leave the room for fifteen minutes so my face could dry. After about fifteen minutes, I came back to find my mother and aunt in the bathroom, drying each other's face with a hair dryer. After seeing this, I just couldn't stand it any longer. I started crying with laughter, my mask cracked, and all my hard work went down the drain. That day was one of the funniest days of my life. We laughed so hard that our abdomens hurt. I love to laugh, as I've said before, and I personally have many different forms of laughter. When I laugh really hard, I laugh all the air out of my lungs and forget to breathe. I have no clue what it looks like to others, but I must be a red - faced girl rocking back and forth. Other times, I kind of have a manly ha - ha, but if you're lucky, you'll get to hear me snort. The thing I'm trying to say is that laughter is a great thing, and it has made a big difference in my life. I don't know what I would do without it. I love to laugh; I think I would die if I couldn't laugh.

The laughter in me. To me, all you need to do to get through a tough and horrible day is a good laugh. It gives you hope throughout the day, and no matter what kind of mood you're in when leaving to work, going to school, or really any activity that involves a "sigh" moment. For me, I get that feeling about school, but I can always count on my best friend, @PERSON1. Every day, she manages to say something totally off - topic, and we end up dying of laughter at the top of the stairs near the science labs where we eat lunch. As people walk by, they give us weird looks, but we don't care because we understand each other. To me, laughter is my way of relieving stress. My best friend agrees with me. Her name is @CAPS2; I call her @ORGANIZATION1. We've been best friends since the second grade. She is my rock. She inspires me to do something with my life, something more than working at some fast - food restaurant. I hang out a lot at her house, and we share so many great and fun memories. It's really bad when we are around each other. It's like one look at each other, and boom! I'm on the floor not breathing because I'm dying of laughter. I don't know what it is, but it's like when we see each other, it's a rush of all the good times we've spent together coming all at once. Sometimes we laugh hysterically over nothing. It doesn't make sense, but I guess that doesn't matter when you're hanging with your best bud. Laughter is an important part of my relationship with anyone. It shows me how fun a person can be and if they have a sense of humor. It shows me that they can smile and not be some stuck - up, want - to - be - perfect robot. All @PERSON1 and I talk about is boys and boy problems, and it makes me laugh and giggle. But when we are in our fifth - period class, forestry and fire, we are like caged monkeys in a zoo. It's like we are magically "high" and all of a sudden have this outburst of energy. We sit next to each other and tickle each other and laugh really loud. By the end of class, I make a paper ball, and we play paper soccer ball. It's so much fun, especially when the teacher gives you dirty looks and tells you to stop, and you don't listen. Let's just say that her face turns a very bright red color. Nothing compares to how much I laugh when I'm with @ORGANIZATION1. When I used to go to @CAPS3, I had three classes with her: @ORGANIZATION3, @ORGANIZATION2, and @CAPS4. We also had lunch together. Anyway, as I was saying, I swear we had a non - stop laughter war every day. My laugh is more like a cackle mixed with giggling. Some people like it; some think it's cute; others think I laugh funny (the weird kind of funny). In @ORGANIZATION2, she'd stand next to me, look at me weirdly, or say something that didn't come out right, or sing obnoxiously. Anything she did cracked me up. It was so distracting when she was around but so much fun. I swear I got all of my exercise from laughing with her. At home, when my family is all together, our way of laughter is mostly picking on one another. It's different from laughter with your friends. We make fun of how my sister @CAPS6 was supposed to be a boy because everybody thought she was going to be a boy when she was in our mother's stomach. We make fun of my brother for being the only boy

The @CAPS1 @CAPS2 @CAPS3  The beautiful flames danced so peacefully in the @CAPS1 air. The faint shimmer of the blaze was the only light we had. As I stared at the majestic destruction of the warm, humid air, I felt someone or something watching me from behind. The weight of the sixty pounds of wood started to get heavy as I walked from one side of the house to the other. Finally, I reached the trailer just to be told by @PERSON4, my best friends mom, the she didn't think we would need that much wood. I thought to myself the this was going to be a long weekend. After about two hours of packing clothes, food, water, sleeping bags, pillows, and tents we headed out for @ORGANIZATION1. It would be about two hours of driving, that felt like twenty minutes. @PERSON3, @PERSON1, @PERSON2, @PERSON4, and I were the worst group of people to put into one car. We all yell and fight and punch at each other just for fun. Once we arrived at our destination, we sprung out of the car like a hive of angry bees. I race @PERSON2 to the @ORGANIZATION1. the second we were done unpacking our belongings. The first few days were spent basking in the one hundred degree heat, swimming, and flirting with the random girls we found around the camp site. We slept as little as possible, so that we could enjoy the friendship and just pure fun we were having. During day two, we decided to go mountain biking. We were on those bikes for hours before we noticed the sun was going down. In the moment we all turned and saw the most extravagant view the earth has ever created. There were burst of orange and red. The colors ricochet from cloud to cloud. After hours of riding our bikes in the heat, we chose to go for a swim. As we swam I felt something touching my foot. Then all of a sudden there was a hand on my foot. When I looked down to see who was grabbing me, it was only a stick. As I looked closer, it turned out to be a root system of a fallen tree. It looked fake, as if someone or something had put it there. This though sparked a conversation about @CAPS2 for the day to come.  The sparks danced together as if they were @CAPS4 and the @LOCATION1. The only light we had was the brilliant glow of the fire. @PERSON3 was playing a gorgeous melody on his guitar. As I listened and enjoyed the flawlessness of nature, I felt someone watching me from behind. I nudged @PERSON3 and when we turned around, our hearts stopped. There was a spinning green light, almost twenty feet in the air. I spoke the word everyone was dreading, @CAPS2. I had slowly stood up and the light started spinning faster. I quickly grabbed the machete, that was next to me, and approached the light. As I grew closer, I could make out small figured in the @CAPS1 shadows. Then, an eruption of children laughing came booming from the direction of the light. A little boy emerged, unable to control is laughter, and ran away. After returning to my seat next to the camp fire, I thought about life. What if @CAPS2 were real and they are watching us. No, there not real. I laughed it off, and continued my week long vacation.

What makes you laugh? Laughter is a truly remarkable stress reliever. There are numerous different types of laughs across the world. Some people's laughs are extremely high - pitched, while others can be very deep and low, like a bass rumble. Some other people snort and make various animal - like noises when they laugh. For me, I have a wide array of laughs corresponding to all the different emotions I experience. When I am upset, I have a very distinctive laugh. Although when I'm upset, I laugh to lift my spirits and have a better day.   One time during a basketball game, I was having a truly off night. Fouls were being called on me constantly, left and right. Normally, when this happens, I get extremely mad, lose my composure, and end up being benched. I absolutely loathe sitting on the bench. This time, after already being threatened to be ejected from the previous game for the same reason, when I got a foul called on me, I decided to just smile and laugh about it. I told myself to shake it off. My coach was very pleased with my change in attitude and simply told me to play defense using my feet, shake off the bad call, and keep my head up. When you're mad, a person can take a lot from the angry looks you make. However, if you just smile and laugh about it, their reactions will be completely different. I'm not the only one on my basketball team who feels this way. Many of us just laugh about the calls and shake them off.   I'm also a cheerleader. As a cheerleader, you should always strive to have a smile on your face and appear to be in a happy mood. I play in a basketball game every night before I go out to cheer. I have to do my best to keep my cool while playing so that I'm in a good mood for cheering after the game. Laughing helps me a great deal in keeping calm and relaxing during the game, so I'm in a positive state for cheerleading.   My coach really emphasizes the importance of having positive attitudes. She tells us at practice that if we just smile and laugh about things that go wrong, the outcome will be far better than if we have bad attitudes. I took this advice to heart, and it has stayed with me. My coach influenced me to have a better attitude, and since then, I've tried to maintain a positive outlook. I keep my positive attitude by smiling and laughing when things in my life go awry.   A laugh can have a profound impact. I personally believe that laughing helps express the mood you're in. It's also beneficial for the body. Laughing can make you feel a hundred times better when you're feeling down. I try my hardest to be in a good mood at all times because I really don't like being in a bad mood; it's no fun. Laughing makes me feel a whole lot better.   I think that laughing is an incredibly good function for the body. When I laugh, it not only improves my mood but also the moods of the people around me. Laughing is a magical feeling that spreads throughout your body and makes you feel warm inside. I firmly believe that everyone should laugh at least once a day. It will surely make your day that much more enjoyable.

Laughter is often referred to as the so - called "best medicine". I don't believe that to be true, but my nephew might have other thoughts. My nephew was "sick" every school day for two weeks. "He just doesn't like school," I would tell his grandma. However, the thought of school being no fun and him not liking it changed significantly for my nephew.   We let him think it was going to be another dull school day, but it was party day for them. Every two weeks, if they work hard, they get a party. Fortunately for them, they have been working diligently. That morning, the stubborn side of my nephew was clearly showing as he resisted every move we made. When we walked through that narrow door, my nephew did something uncharacteristic, not just for him but for five - year - olds all over the country. He stood as still and silent as a marble statue. It couldn't have been a more perfect setup! There were streamers, balloons, food, party hats, and bags; they really went all out for the first party of the year. The aroma of the food made my stomach growl with hunger. Above all, there were delicious desserts like cakes, cookies, and pie, all freshly cooked just thirty feet away. So when you walked through that door, your mouth would instantly fill with warm saliva.   These children played with amazing speed, like ninjas. One moment they were in front of you, and the next, they disappeared in the blink of an eye. It took me at least an hour to find my nephew in that small room. Then I realized it's easier to sit down and let them find you. As my butt hit the cold, hard, and almost unbearable floor, my nephew was suddenly in front of me. He had this huge ear - to - ear grin on his face that startled me because he never had such a big grin unless he had a plan. He definitely had a plan, and in seconds, my face was wet.   He had been hiding a squirt gun behind his back and had an escape route planned. With the chairs and short tables arranged as they were, it was very difficult for my long legs to maneuver through them. It was extremely challenging to catch up in the room, but once we got into the hallway where I could stretch my legs, it was an easy chase. His ear - to - ear grin disappeared when I caught him, but the laughter on both sides continued. He got my face, but I got his head!   My nephew loves school now. It's almost the end of his first year, and they still have great parties, but thanks to us, there are no more squirt guns. I think if we had waited any longer, it would have taken more effort to get him to like school. My nephew is a very smart, athletic, and good - natured child. He will do just fine in school, and I pity the child who tries to fight him because he's strong and full of spirit.

I know you guys hear the same things repeatedly, but I also know that a lot of people don't really answer the prompt you give them. Well, I'm sorry because I wasn't able to answer the prompt either. I can't remember when the last time I had a really good laugh was within the past couple of years. So, I'll tell you why laughter is special to me instead. What's so special about laughter? For me, laughter helps us in numerous ways. I'll talk about how laughter is beneficial for my health, how everyone's laughs are unique and can even make us laugh at them, and why laughter is so special to me.   I've always felt this strange sensation in my head after I laugh. I think it's because endorphins are being released into my brain. If I laugh too hard, my stomach starts to hurt because laughing also burns calories and works out my abdominal muscles. I also believe it benefits all three aspects of the health triangle. Socially, I laugh with my friends and it strengthens our bonds. Emotionally, laughing makes me feel happy and content. Physically, it's always fun when I work out with a friend and we share laughs.   I think that everyone's laugh is unique in its own way. I also know that sometimes it's really funny to listen to other people chuckle, snort, or sound like a mouse when they laugh. Our laughs are yet another thing that makes us who we are!   Laughing is special to me because of all the people who make me laugh. My friends are like the family I've chosen for myself. My family makes me laugh and fills me with happiness every day. It's special because these people are precious to me. Laughing with my father is a different experience compared to laughing with my mother. Laughing with my friends can never be the same as laughing with my significant other.   My life is centered around laughter, and it's truly special to me. It's not like chewing a piece of gum; it's an entirely different thing. There's nothing more fun than having a girls' night and laughing all night long, or going out dancing and having the most romantic night of your life. Laughter is an essential part of life.   So, embrace laughter, cherish the moments when you laugh, and let it bring joy to your life.

Laughter has been a consistent and powerful force in many of my relationships. I believe that laughter is invaluable in getting to know new people and growing closer to those you care about. In my opinion, laughter brings people closer and can transform a bad situation into a good one.   It was in the year when I was fifteen and a sophomore at my new school. It was my first year there. I've attended many schools, like the one in my old neighborhood and others. Similar to any new school, I was struggling to connect socially with my peers. Every day, I'd wake up, get ready, go to school, come home, maybe do some homework, and then go to bed. It was a monotonous cycle that I seemed trapped in.   The idea of trying to be cool and fit in didn't work very well. I realized that trying to be someone you're not only gets you so far. What kids and people in general like is when you're genuine and true to yourself. I discovered this later on, but I didn't initially realize that's what people appreciated the most. I once told myself that I didn't like pretending to be someone else because deep down, I thought I was a cool person. So, I changed my approach. I stopped trying to act cool and started being myself.   It turned out that I actually was cool, and girls found me attractive. They saw me not only as good - looking but also as a funny and likable person. My main asset, besides my looks, was my ability to make people laugh or at least smile. This ability helped me gain many friends that I didn't have at the beginning. It even helped me win the heart of one of the most beautiful girls I'd ever seen.   Her name was Sarah. In my eyes, there was no girl who could compare to her. She had an hour - glass figure, caramel - colored skin, and a face like a goddess (and I'm not exaggerating). Like any beautiful girl, she had many admirers, just like me. So, what chance did I have? What could I, a regular guy, offer her? Laughter. My greatest strength that had come to my rescue on many occasions.   Although our relationship didn't last as long as I'd hoped (I wanted it to be forever), it was wonderful being with her for the time we had. The things we did together and the experiences we shared are priceless. It was all because of my ability to make her laugh and put a smile on her face.   I believe that without laughter, this world wouldn't be the same place it is today. Sure, there's still crime and many horrible things happening, but imagine how much worse it would be without laughter. Joy, which I think is at the core of what laughter brings, allows us to forgive and forget. It allows us to move on from difficult situations.   Without laughter, it would be much harder to face the challenges of life. Laughter is like a ray of sunshine in the darkest of times, and it makes the world a more bearable place.

Laughter can truly be the best part of life. It typically expresses feelings of happiness and joy. The expression of laughter almost seems contagious; one laugh, accompanied by a warm smile, can significantly improve someone's day. Perhaps the best thing about laughter is that it's not hard to find. There are countless things in our world that are worthy of a good laugh.   I personally find myself laughing the most when I'm around people I enjoy being with. Some people think the key to happiness might be love, joy, or being content with yourself. I think the key is surrounding yourself with the ones you love and care for because everything seems better when they're around. They're like sunshine; everything becomes brighter in their presence.   My favorite memory filled with excessive laughter took place on a warm summer day at my friend's house just outside the city limits. It must have been around five in the evening. The summer air was warm but not oppressively hot; it was the perfect afternoon. My friends and I were hanging out, playing catch with a football, building a fire, and simply having a great time. We had all the elements needed for the best night of our lives.   The most vivid memory I have is when we were playing catch. I threw a long pass to my friend, and as he was running to catch the ball, he ran straight into a fence. He got up laughing, and the laughter quickly spread among us. That moment set the tone for the rest of the night. The rest of the evening seemed like it could have been taken straight out of a movie. Everything was going smoothly, and we were all in high spirits. It was the epitome of happiness. Laughter filled the air, and smiles stretched across all our faces. It was undoubtedly my best memory of laughter.   In conclusion, laughter has the power to create unforgettable moments and bring people closer together. It's a precious part of life that we should cherish and seek out. We should always try to surround ourselves with people who make us laugh and create more of these wonderful memories.

Laughter is the essence of life. Without the warm, infectious sound of laughter, my life would be a desolate, meaningless expanse. And without that sense of pure happiness or the gentle touch of compassion, life simply wouldn't be worth living. My sister is the only person I whole - heartedly trust with my innermost secrets. She has this magical ability to make me happy when I'm feeling down in the dumps. My sister and I share a special bond; we laugh with each other at our own silly jokes. My sister is like my other half, and we share everything, from our favorite snacks to our wildest dreams. She makes me laugh with her witty remarks and is always there when I need her a shoulder to cry on. I'll always be there for her also, through thick and thin. Laughter is an important part of life. @CAPS2, my sister and I laugh and play like carefree children. One day I came off the bus from school, my heart heavy and my eyes filled with tears. All I could do was cry. As I waited for my sister's bus to arrive, the tears fell down like a relentless river flowing. The bus appeared on the horizon, and a sense of joy fluttered in my chest with it. @CAPS1, it wasn't the bus that brought my joy. It was my sister. Right away, she could feel my pain and noticed my tear - streaked face. I could see in her face, the love and care that only a sister can offer. She asked me what's wrong, and I could hear the worry lacing her voice. My river of tears stopped, and I began to speak. I could tell her everything, without trying to hold anything back. The words flowed through my mouth like a gushing stream. @CAPS1 need to think of what to say. I told her what happened without a single pause. Afterwards, she told me something I'll never forget. She said, "@CAPS1 matter whatever happens, I'll always love you." @CAPS2 we laughed. It was the sweetest laugh, a symphony of happiness that filled the air. Nothing that people say about me is true, so I learned to laugh at it. Laughter truly is the best medicine for the soul.

The night was dark and cloudy, casting a gloomy shadow over my surroundings. The shadows slithered across the street, illuminated by the passing cars and the footsteps of pedestrians under the lamp light. My day had been nothing short of depressing, and it seemed that karma was out to get me. Everything that could go wrong; did go wrong. And the rest of my night was only going to get worse. Earlier that day, I had upset my girlfriend with a thoughtless statement that should not have been stated. Resulting in her calling me as soon as I sat down on my bed, exhausted from the day's events. The words we exchanged were like fire, leaving smoldering wreckage in our wake. Our conversation ended in fury and the disconnection of phones. Once I laid back down in my bed, and my anger slowly diminished, I began to feel an overwhelming sense of guilt. I said things that were unnecessary and horrible, words that I wish I could take back. As I laid on my bed, my heart felt like it was slowly being squeezed by some unseen force. It labored my breathing, and soon tears began to fall from my eyes, hot and heavy. The guilt and agony crept through my soul like a burglar creeping through a dark house, and stealing whatever valuables I had left. My day had ended in tears and pain. But then my phone rang once more. Quickly I wiped the tears from my face and proceeded to read the caller I.D. It turned out to be my best friend, and so I answered not knowing what @CAPS1 wanted. @CAPS1 asked if I wanted to hang out and possibly catch a bite to eat. His words lifted my spirit even if it was only half an inch. When @CAPS1 pulled into my driveway, I was there waiting for him. I climbed into the passenger's seat, and immediately @CAPS1 knew something was wrong. @CAPS1 asked me if something had happened, and I replied with a one - worded answer, "@PERSON1." @CAPS1 knew that it was not the right time to talk about it, and so we drove to the nearest restaurant and found our seats. We both ordered coffee, and I began to rip open sugar packets vigorously and dump them into my steaming cup of coffee. @CAPS1 did the same but with much less force. Then @CAPS1 cautiously asked me if I wanted to talk about it. I looked up from the mess surrounding my coffee cup and slowly nodded my head. I started to spill out all the events of my day in rapid succession, bringing a storm of swearing and profane language. My best friend just sat there and listened until my voice grew softer and my fists unclenched. We sat there in silence for a short time while @CAPS1 chose his words carefully. Then @CAPS1 decided to change the subject for the time being because @CAPS1 saw that I was still squeezing my car keys. @CAPS1 asked how things were with my mother, and another storm of curses poured from my mouth. We became silent again, and then @CAPS1 asked me, "@CAPS2 you feel better now that you got it all out?" I looked at him puzzled because it was not the reply I expected. After thinking about it, I replied yes. We then enjoyed our dinner, paid, and left. My mood had been lifted, but I was still upset. So we drove down to the river and exited his claustrophobic car. @CAPS1 and I walked down to the bank and stood there just staring at the water. @CAPS1 then asked if I wanted to hear a joke, and after a pause, I said yes. The joke @CAPS1 told me probably should not be repeated, but it made me laugh so hard I had trouble breathing. His timing was impeccable, and it made my mood soar. I have always turned to my friends when I felt down. And they have always been there, proving I can count on them. That day had been a disaster, but the rest of the night turned out to be far better than I had hoped. It is not only the fact that my friends can lift my mood, but it is also important that they make me laugh. Because if you're counting on someone to brighten your day, what better way to @CAPS2 it than to make them laugh. Laughter has always held important meaning in my life. I laugh every day. Mostly because I find the most idiotic things hilarious. I know that laughter will never disappear from my life, and it will always be a source of comfort and joy.

Being with people that can always make you feel comfortable and be yourself around is most likely the best quality in a friend. Everyone has their flaws; a true friend can always look past them and find the good in the one that they trust. A friend can tell a well - timed joke and make you laugh until you cry, the kind of laugh that leaves your stomach aching and your eyes watering. Making someone laugh can always help when they think that it's not possible for their life to get any worse. Laughter is the most valued gift that can be given. You know inside that it's making them happy just from seeing the wide smile on their face, a smile that reaches their eyes and lights them up. There have been many times in my life where I have laughed so hard that I cried. There is truly no greater feeling in the world than knowing that you have people in your life that can cheer you up just by doing or even saying something so ridiculous that it just breaks you into a hysterical laughter. I laugh a lot throughout the day. When I don't, people get suspicious and they feel like there's something wrong with me. That's literally how much of a role that laughing plays in my life. Laughing is my second language in life. There has been one time in particular in my life span so far that has made me laugh so hard that I cried tremendously hard. My friends were staying the @TIME1 at my house, and we were just being boys, full of energy and mischief. We did so many things that made us question our sanity: we ate hot sauce by the spoon - full, feeling the fiery burn in our throats but still laughing through the pain; we watched comedy shows, our sides splitting with each joke; and we also ate ourselves sick, our bellies full but our spirits high. It was the time of a lifetime and we laughed through it all. While watching the comedy shows, we couldn't breathe. We were laughing so hard! Nothing could make me stop laughing; I would just keep replaying every joke in my head and I'd start laughing even more. I already hurt so much as it was when we were watching it from earlier. The comedian was a magician with words; the way he put them all together just seemed like he was reading a sacred scroll from ancient times. I laughed and cried over and over again. I probably did that for ten minutes straight! It was unbelievable. Making these life - long memories with my friends is something that I will never forget. I truly know how great I have it in my life; people would kill to be in my shoes and to get the love and support I get from my friends and family. All my experiences are the things I learn from, whether they're good or bad, I know that it's all going to help me later in life to be able to make the right decision when it is presented to me. All the laughs I share with other people makes me know that they have had a good time throughout their day because they smiled and laughed with me. They made a point in my day great as well. Being myself around them is great as well because I know that they have already accepted me into their lives and I don't have to try to be anyone else. Everyone laughs at some point or another throughout their lives no matter how much they deny it. I really don't even know why they would because what better feeling is there than being able to let out a little giggle every once in a while? I really don't think that there is any. I feel really honored that I have such amazing people in my life that always make it exciting and full of laughter and life. It shouldn't be any other way in my personal opinion. Live life to the fullest; why would you want to live it any other way? Laughter is the key to a happy and fulfilling life.

It's always hard to know what to do when a friend or family member comes to you when they are sad or mad. Most of the time you don't know what to do. I have learned that making people laugh with something as simple as a joke can always make them feel better. As I was sitting at home one sunny afternoon, relaxing on the couch, I got a call from my friend @PERSON1. When I put the phone to my ear, all I could hear was a loud, heart - wrenching crying. @PERSON1 wasn't saying anything to me, not one word. Even though, I repeatedly asked her what was wrong with her, @PERSON1 wouldn't even say a word. Not knowing what to do or say to her anymore, I asked her to calm down and take deep breaths, my voice soft and soothing. Couple minutes later, @PERSON1 started explaining to me what had happened. @PERSON1 started off by telling me she was irresponsible, that she didn't pay attention to what was happening around her. I asked her why she was saying that about herself because I knew she was a responsible person. Finally, @PERSON1 screamed that while she was home watching the @CAPS1 basketball team play basketball, her dog @CAPS2 got run over. The dog had actually died. I found it very ridiculous and pathetic that @PERSON1 would be crying over her dog. I didn't want to be rude about it and tell her what was going through my mind at that time. Even though that was the way I felt about the whole situation. I thought of what the words I needed to say to @PERSON1 but I was confused. Actually, it wasn't so much that I was confused, I was afraid of hurting her feelings with my words. Finally, I decided to tell her not to worry about her dog, that my friend had a couple of dogs for sale. Also, I told @PERSON1 that if it made her feel any better I would buy her a new puppy. After saying that to her, there was an awkward silence. My hands started to get shaky because I thought @PERSON1 was mad. All of the sudden I just heard her start laughing really loud and once again she couldn't talk. I felt so relieved that I had made her laugh and not cry or get mad at me. @PERSON1 wouldn't shut her mouth; she just laughed and laughed and laughed hysterically. Finally, she shut her mouth up and started talking to me again. @PERSON1 thanked me for making her laugh and making a joke out of the situation. Rather than saying depressing words that would make her feel bad and make her cry even more. I was happy I made her laugh because she felt better about herself and not worse. As I was laughing, I told her that anytime she needed to laugh I was the person she needed to call. Anytime, any day and anywhere I would be happy to bring a smile to her face and a loud laugh to her mouth. @PERSON1 laughed with me and thanked me one more time for making her laugh. From that day on, I always like to make people laugh because I know I'm going to make them feel better. I sure love it when others make me laugh too. It's just an amazing feeling, a great feeling that everyone loves and can't really describe. After making my friend @PERSON1 laugh, I found out laughter was a key element of life, a powerful tool to heal the heart and lift the spirit.
Laughter is an important element to have in life. Because without @CAPS3

Someone once said, "Laughter is the shortest distance between two people." To me, that means since everyone laughs, laughter is the quickest and easiest way to connect with another person. I believe this because there was a time when my older brother and I didn't get along well. We hardly ever spent time together, and when we did, we'd either be arguing or ignoring each other. It wasn't a big issue as he's five years older. But once I grew older, we started seeing each other more often. So, one day, we decided to sit down and talk. We weren't sure what to say, so for the first ten minutes, we just sat in silence on the back porch in the middle of the afternoon. Then, out of nowhere, he tumbled backwards into a bush. We both laughed harder than we ever had. Since then, when my family gets together, there's little arguing. We all sit, share stories, and laugh. For my family and friends, laughter is a crucial part of a relationship because it brings happiness, and with happiness comes love. Love is the most important thing in life. So, I firmly say, "Laughter is the shortest distance between all people."  ### Item 2 This true story might sound a bit cheesy, but it's real, and in my view, it's a love story. I'll use different names instead of the real ones. On @DATE1, after a long and tiring day at school, @PERSON1 decided to log on to @CAPS1 - book to chat with some new online friends. @PERSON1 had forgotten that she'd sent a friend request to @PERSON2. When @PERSON2 accepted the request, @PERSON1 suddenly remembered it. @PERSON2 and @PERSON1 started getting to know each other more and more with each passing minute. Before that, they had no idea who the other was. After a long chat, @PERSON2 gave @PERSON1 his number so she could call or text him when off @CAPS1 - book. @PERSON2 was starting to like @PERSON1, and @PERSON1 felt the same. @PERSON1 learned that @PERSON2 is a high - school sophomore, @NUM1 years old, and they have mutual friends. @PERSON1 really liked talking to @PERSON2, and @PERSON2 felt the same about @PERSON1. @PERSON1 noticed that @PERSON2 loved to laugh a great deal. It always made her day. @PERSON2 knew @PERSON1 had recently broken up with her boyfriend, but he didn't mind. He really liked @PERSON1 and hoped he could make her happy. Then he asked @PERSON1 if she'd be his girlfriend. Without hesitation, she said, "@CAPS3 I would very much like to be your girlfriend." "@CAPS4 you would?" asked @PERSON2. "@CAPS3 why wouldn't I?" replied @PERSON1. "@CAPS6 I thought you wouldn't because you recently got out of a relationship," @PERSON2 answered. Days passed, and they were doing great until @PERSON1 started getting texts from her ex - boyfriend, which affected her relationship with @PERSON2. But @PERSON2 kept fighting for their relationship. One night, while on the phone, @PERSON2 asked @PERSON1 if she'd try to forget her ex. @PERSON1 was scared but honest, saying, "@CAPS8 @PERSON2 I'll try but I'm not promising anything." Since they communicate well when laughing, @PERSON1 changed the subject and asked @PERSON2 if he'd do her a favor. Of course, @PERSON2 agreed. The favor was for him to laugh for her. "@CAPS11!" @PERSON2 laughed. "@CAPS12 can you do me that favor?" @PERSON1 asked. "@CAPS3, @CAPS11!" @PERSON2 laughed again. Who'd think laughter could make a relationship so much better? It may not make it perfect, but it's far better than arguing over silly things. I believe laughter plays an excellent role in any relationship. It's like a universal language for communication. I hope you liked this true story about how laughter is important in relationships.  ### Item 3 My relationship with laughter. Well, the first time I encountered the power of laughter was when I met my boyfriend. Before that, I was constantly depressed, and my friends were fed up with it. But when my friends introduced us, I fell in love for the first time. I was finally happy, no longer depressed and alone, crying in a corner. That was the first time in almost a year that I smiled. My friends knew then that I'd found someone who'd care for me and love me for who I am. As our relationship developed, laughter became a constant presence. I was always laughing when I was with him, not sad anymore. At first, it took all our friends to encourage us to hang out. After we started spending time together, we got to know each other better than when we first met. It wasn't until freshman year that we started dating. Then, I found out that someone else thought I was dating him. I didn't believe it until that guy came up and started shouting at me. My boyfriend came and comforted me in front of my friends and said, "@CAPS1 are @CAPS3 cheating on me and it's over?" with a guy @CAPS3 just met. He tried to end things, but I told him, "We were never dating in the first place!" My friends saw me in tears and asked what was wrong, trying to find me someone new. By the time they did, I was with another guy, and I'm truly happy with him. He's always there for me, no matter what. He's the best thing that's ever happened to me. He makes me laugh when I'm upset or angry, saying, "Don't worry, everything will be okay. I promise, so just believe in me." Laughter has been part of our relationship for almost a year. We don't want to change that unless one of us messes up again. We've made so many mistakes that we're not sure what to do. If laughter leaves, I don't know what I'll do. It's now an essential part of my life and our relationship. Let's hope we can keep it together this time. This part of our relationship is the best, and I hope it won't change. If it did, I'd go back to fearing my step - dad. I'm glad I found someone. I hope laughter stays because it comes with him. No one, not even my friends and family, could make me laugh when I was crying. Now that laughter is almost always here, I can't wait for sorrow to disappear. Me and him are happy together, and I hope nothing goes wrong because we love each other deeply. I'm not my lively self when he's not around. Six to @CAPS2 of my friends say, "@CAPS3 are losing your bubbly self. Don't let her disappear. She'll guide @CAPS3." They also told my dad that I don't hang out with them much. The reason is that they can be bossy and tell me what I can and can't do. Can't people understand that this relationship won't work if they keep interfering? They think my life revolves around them, but it doesn't. My relationship with laughter is about me and my boyfriend, not my friends and family. That's why I'm sharing this story about my relationship with laughter. I hope this relationship has a happy ending without anyone or anything getting in the way. I wish there was a place we could go where no one would know. I hope nothing tears us apart because we love each other so much.  ### Item 4 "Laughter" I once heard a man say, "Laughing is the key to happiness, and if you don't laugh, you aren't healthy." Why do people love to laugh? Because laughing creates wonderful memories, banishes sadness, gives you energy, and can even give your abdomen a good workout depending on how hard and long you laugh. There's nothing like a really funny movie that makes you laugh so hard that you cry, your jaw aches, and your stomach is sore the next day. Some of my favorite movies are comedies. I bet laughing or making someone else laugh could help you land a job. Suppose you go for an interview for a job where you'll work with people daily. Are you going to be dull and monotone? No, you'll go in, make the interviewer laugh, and act like you've known them for ages. However, laughter can be misused. It can be used in bad ways, like making fun of people just because it might seem funny. For example, calling kids in gym class names because they can't throw a baseball as far as you. Laughter can make people feel on top of the world or as bad as a basketball player missing the game - winning shot at the buzzer. Be careful when using laughter; treat it like a loaded gun because using it wrongly can hurt someone. A few hours after my @CAPS4 passed away, my family and I started talking about all the great times we'd spent with her. I noticed tears rolling down my @CAPS5 @PERSON1's cheeks. Then we began to recall the times she'd get really angry and swear at my dad when he was a boy, and then get embarrassed for using the Lord's name in vain. Thinking about those moments, we started to laugh, not just a little giggle but full - on laughter. It chased away the sadness that had filled the room all night. I'll never forget how that laughter became such an emotional memory later in life.  ### Item 5 Laughter is important in my life for many reasons. Without it, my life wouldn't be as wonderful as it is now. I have many people in my life who make laughter the best way to brighten my day, including my friends, family, and boyfriend. I have many stories involving laughter, but I'll tell you about how my boyfriend used it to make me feel better when my stomach hurt. It all happened on a @DATE1 @TIME1 as I was heading home from my boyfriend's house. My stomach started to ache, and I told my boyfriend. He said it was probably because I hadn't eaten. I was worried as it was going to be a long trip home. On the way to my house, my boyfriend tried to distract me from my stomach pain. He asked about my day at school, and I said it was okay. We talked for a while until my boyfriend took off his hat and said, "From flat to volume!" When he said that, I burst out laughing! I laughed so hard that my stomach, which had hurt from not eating, now ached from laughing. I laughed because my boyfriend's hair was all messed up and looked so funny. As I tried to stop laughing, I asked him why his hair was like that. He said that when he was taking a shower, he'd grabbed a shampoo bottle that said "from flat to volume," and he didn't expect his hair to have so much volume. The whole way home, I couldn't stop laughing. I'd forgotten about my stomach ache. Even to this day, I still laugh about my boyfriend's hair. We have an inside joke now. Every time I say "from flat to volume," we both start laughing. I know that laughter is the best medicine for me when I have a stomach ache. Laughter will always be a part of me and my life, and nothing can change that.

Have you ever wondered how you and your best friends even became friends? Maybe not, but perhaps you've pondered it and couldn't recall. Well, this story I'm about to tell you today is about how my friend @PERSON3 and I became friends. I'm also going to share how we've stayed friends for so long and all the little details that have kept our friendship strong. Admittedly, we didn't start off as friends who laughed all the time. Instead, we began as a crier and a helper.  @PERSON3 and I first met in the eighth grade. I had just been called out of my first - period class and was greeted by my math teacher @PERSON1. @PERSON1 told me that we had just gotten a new student who had moved here from @LOCATION1 and was clearly not happy about the move. She also asked me if I wouldn't mind showing her around the school with another classmate, @PERSON4. I agreed and walked into the room where @PERSON3 was. When I saw her, the first thing I noticed were her tear - filled eyes as the tears streamed down her face. Then I realized she was a very pretty girl who, as @PERSON1 had said, was quite unhappy. I'll admit I was a bit scared to try and show her around, seeing as she was so clearly not happy to be here. But once we started our tour, she had calmed down a great deal, yet she still wouldn't even crack a smile at our feeble attempts to tell jokes. I still felt like I needed to make her happy, so I pulled out the big guns. I walked in a strange, wobbly way and talked in a funny, high - pitched voice. I even started saying random, silly things during long pauses. Eventually, she smiled, so I kept going. Toward the end, I got her and @PERSON4 to laugh so hard that we all almost wet ourselves.  But as funny as that initial encounter was, it definitely wasn't the last funny thing we did. You know the type of funny things that happen, and no matter what, you always remember them when you see the person it happened with, right? Well, to say the least, @PERSON3 and I have a lot of those moments. Granted, a lot of them happen with other people, but that's what makes it even more fun. Like this one time in our drawing and painting class, we - @PERSON3, @LOCATION2, @CAPS1, and I - were all in @PERSON2's little office getting a picture to draw. I had been hyper pretty much all day, and so had @CAPS3. I randomly looked around the room and saw a really cute - looking poster I hadn't noticed before, and without realizing it, I had said aloud, "@CAPS2, that's really cute." @CAPS3 started laughing and holding on to the desk to keep from falling to the ground. I still hadn't realized I'd said it aloud and was really confused but still laughing because watching them laugh was really entertaining. They finally calmed down long enough to tell me what I'd just said, and I blushed but started laughing along. Now every time they see me and remember that moment, they crack up laughing and they point to something and say it the way I said it. That's why I think that having these big memories of really funny things has kept us together. It helps us remember the fun times during the tough ones. It also strengthens our bond within the group of our friends.  But the little things matter too. Every small, funny thing we do together as friends has an impact later. If we only had big, grand funny moments or just boring ones, I don't think our friendship would last long. Like when we're talking and one of us accidentally burps or farts while walking. Or maybe when I laugh and I hide my face with my hands and my arms jiggle in a funny way. Possibly even when we say something weird or walk funny because we really have to go to the bathroom. It's not just being friends that keeps us together; it's how we are and who we become with that other person. I feel like I become a better person, and I believe I help her become one too. Besides, the little things are just as funny as the big things we do.  So, as I've stated before, laughter is a big part of a friendship. @PERSON3 and my friendship didn't start with laughter; it started with tears and grew into a beautiful friendship filled with laughter. Laughter brought us together in an act of weirdness, and it has remained strong ever since, not only because we have a lot in common (frankly, we don't have that much in common), but because of the big, hilarious moments we've shared, not only with each other but also with other people, and the little things we do on a daily basis that we find so funny.

I ain't heard anything like it." @PERSON3 came in and said, "yes, her laugh is really something." Laughing makes you live longer. That's what I was told as a child, and I wholeheartedly believe it. I think laughing is truly important in life, and especially in relationships. When a baby laughs, to me, it means that baby is going to be a happy human. In movies and TV shows, sometimes I laugh. Laughter. We all need it. We need it as a reminder that there is hope for those who have perseverance, for those who strive not to better others, but for those who strive to better themselves. We need it as a reminder to live our dreams, instead of dreaming of living. And, in my opinion, most importantly, as a reminder that even though we sometimes make mistakes, there is still a chance for those who simply have the courage to seize it.   In the evening, my foster parents decided to go out for dinner. The children, of course, were not invited. We were to either stay home with the babysitter, or go to a friend's house. No one wanted to stay home, as there was nothing to do. One of my best friends, Sarah, was a single child living with her grandmother. I made a quick phone call and ten minutes later I was waiting for her grandmother to pick me up. It was about five in the afternoon, and I was to be back no later than nine. I had four hours, and it was two weeks before Christmas. Neither of us knew what to do with so much time on our hands. After all, we only saw each other for a few hours at school. This way new to both of us. We were both sophomores, and I had a crush on Jake. This turned out to be a big problem, considering Sarah knew this piece of information. Sarah didn't have a problem with it, but Tom, her boyfriend, did. We got along, but he didn't like the fact that I was spending so much time with her, especially while he wasn't around. He trusted me to take care of her though, so he didn't make a huge deal out of it.   We had decided to set up the Christmas tree first, and go from there. We both had shiny ornaments, so just about everything on the tree was shiny. Tinsels, ornaments, pictures, you name it. It took about twenty minutes to get everything set up, not including the time it took to unpack all the decorations. It looked magnificent when we were done. I'd help make some pretty looking trees, but this was by far the best. I was proud of our work. I didn't have much in my life to appreciate, so this was one of those things that normally wouldn't matter, but suddenly became really important. We admired our work for a few minutes and then went down to the den. Sarah got on the computer to talk to Tom for a bit, while I texted my girlfriend. I was in the process of preparing myself to break up with her.   Sarah and I had been together for most of my sophomore year, and I was beginning to regret it. Our relationship had started when one of my buddies, Mike, and hers ended. I know this sounds bad, but I really didn't want to be with her at first. I was putting myself between Mike and her so that they would stop fighting so much. Now I was starting to see why he broke up with her in the first place. She was like a bad drug that got you really high, and then dropped you like a rock. She was extremely controlling. She wasn't right for me, and Sarah had finally convinced me that enough was enough. After I broke up with Sarah, I felt both happy, and depressed. I was happy that I could be free, but I was depressed because I felt so alone. I'd never been good at getting close to people, so this was hard for me to do.   Seeing me so roughed up didn't sit well with Sarah. She knew me much better than most people, so she knew that I needed help quick. She did something so subtle, that to most it would have seemed unimportant. She took one look at me, got up from the computer, and gave me a long hug. At first I didn't think it was a good idea. Her boyfriend was very protective of Sarah. He didn't like guys getting close to her, under any circumstances.   "Please just try to relax for a minute? You're making me nervous." she said in that tone that meant it was more of an order than a question. Maybe it was the fact that I was in such a bad mood that this seemed like the funniest thing in the world to me. I started laughing really hard.   "See. That wasn't so hard, was it?" as she pulled away from the embrace, I kissed her forehead; our way of saying "you're beautiful."   "Are you going to be okay?" she asked in a worried voice.   "Yes, I'll be fine. Thanks Sarah."   "Come on. You never showed me that guitar thing."   "What guitar thing?"   "You said you played guitar." then I realized that I might not ever get another friend like this one.   "Okay. Come on. I'll show you how to play, man.

As people have bonded over the years, those bonds have been strengthened by laughter, joy, and trust. All of these are important, and they all work together to build these bonds. For normal people to enjoy one another, they must have fun, and fun begins with laughter. Laughter comes from the brain, and if two people think the same thing is funny, it brings them together with their similar interests.   By telling a funny joke or being a person who always ends up with a smile on his or her face, it brings people around more easily. Since I was young, I've always been a real happy kid and one who is easy to be around. I believe I am like this because my parents have always told me, "People that are happy are the ones people want to be around." Clearly, by being a seemingly happy person, it has given me the friends I have. Although I have never really understood what it meant because it could mean many different things.   Whenever I'm with my friends, looking back on it now, we are always laughing or joking about something. We could be laughing about ourselves, or we could be laughing at a random person on the street. We could be doing absolutely nothing and be laughing at something stupid, but still be having good times. It might be starting an argument that is funny to us. If someone starts saying stupid stuff, then one of us will jump on the chance to make him sound as stupid as possible. Most of the time we won't get butt hurt about it, but a lot of the time we will take it too far. With all the laughter we have shared before, it keeps us friends. Stupidity and pain are probably the top two reasons why we laugh. Stupidity would be if someone says something that doesn't make sense or came in at the wrong time. I have never understood why we laugh at pain. Maybe it is because we are glad that it is not us in pain, although sometimes it is. Maybe it is because we know that they will get over it. When someone is hurt badly, and another person is laughing about it, a lot of the time I will see them get angry because they are being made fun of for their pain. They need to just realize that it is funny for people to get hurt and know that they laugh at it too.   Laughter will always bring people into relationships. It shows common interests and what people can tolerate from others. Laughter is the main component to bringing happiness into people's lives. Without happiness and laughter, this world would be super boring.

Laughter is a mystery. It happens whenever it pleases. It puts smiles on faces. Laughter just happens in many ways it can. Although, mine just happened to end up in a crazy situation with a huge mess to follow it. Things got extreme, unforgettable. Things you could never forget.   Around two months ago, in the cold winter evening. It was my sixteenth birthday. I threw a little party for myself at my house. Though, I was in for a little treat. When everyone arrived, they all had a smirk on their faces. Nobody would tell me what was going on. I started to become distraught about it all. Until my buddy Mark and my boyfriend Tom walked into the kitchen with a sixteen - pound bucket full of spaghetti, with a ten - pound gallon can of tomato sauce. Next thing I knew my mouth was agape. I couldn't believe my eyes, not understanding why so much of it. Also, why did they have it. My mother walked out and exclaimed "Load up the cars, and let's go!"   When we approached the park, I had a funny feeling in the pit of my gut. I looked around and noticed my sister - in - law was holding a video camera. Right then and there I knew something was going to happen. Something big, extraordinary, out of the extreme, and I was right. Spaghetti was flying everywhere, getting in people's hair, faces. Clothes were getting stained and messy. Not to mention it was cold, wet, and rainy outside. The fog made it hard to see who you were hitting and who was throwing it at you. By the end of the noodle war, I looked the worst. Even now the shoes I was wearing are stained.   When we got back to my house, we had to wash down with the hose. I swore I was going to get sick from the cold water running down my face. I could feel noodles falling out of my hair and clothing, the sauce streaming down my face. Laughing here and laughing there. Everyone was laughing at others for how badly they were covered with noodles and sauce. Eventually, we all got hungry. We decided on nachos. So, my mom poured two family - size nacho chips on the table followed by two ten - gallon cans of nacho cheese with jalapenos, olives. You might think the noodle and sauce was messy, well that's where I went wrong. My friend Lily dropped nachos on my couch. Mark threw nacho cheese at Lisa, she threw chips at the group by the window. Mark tossed cheese at me and ended up on my dog. Let's just say my living room was a cheese fest. I couldn't believe that nacho cheese got stuck in my dog's fur and in all the girls' hair. Chip crumbs were in the couch and cheese was on the floor and the Christmas tree. So Mark finally said "No more nachos!"   Then on it was cake time. Ginger thought that there wasn't going to be another mess. Well once again she was wrong. They all started singing the happy birthday song, cameras were flashing, my mother in the background crying. She cries on our birthdays because she says it's just a year closer to her kids moving out. I figured she would be used to it knowing that she already had two kids move out. All of a sudden there was frosting on my face! I rubbed the frosting off and smeared it on Tom's face. Though he just rubbed it back onto mine. My mom grabbed a plate and threw it at Emily, she tossed it at Lily then the group by the window and Mark then Jake. Chocolate frosting was everywhere along with nacho cheese. Soon after that we played video games. Of course me being me I played Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 live on Xbox Live. I got irritated with someone on the game and ended up throwing the controller at my television and broke it. Mother wasn't too pleased with me after that. Oh well, we still got to watch movies in the other room. Eventually people started leaving. Saying our goodbyes, "I'll see you later", "peace out dude". We said it all. I looked back in the living room and saw nothing but a huge mess of chips, nacho cheese, and cake. Not to mention my broken TV. I got stuck cleaning the mess for over three hours. Though, we were laughing the entire time it happened. Having the greatest time ever with each other. If I could I would go back and do it all over again just for the fun and laughs. Laughter is everywhere. You might not see it right away. Though you will once you start laughing your brains out. Laughing puts everyone in good moods and smiles on their faces. It might also make a mess and put things in a crazy situation. You can't deny after those crazy situations that you would go back and do it again. Laughter is the greatest thing in this world we call Earth.

Laughter  By PERSON1  Laughter has many benefits that make us have, or might make us have, more distance between two people, or it might make us have differences in the relationships we have with people. But many other people believe and think that laughter is an important part of any relationship with our friends, family, etc. Now I'm going to talk about a few reasons of how laughter can be a benefit to us, and how it can also make us have distances from people, or how laughter works in the relationships we have with friends.  Many people think that it's really fun to laugh about simple things, and that's me. I can laugh at things that might not seem funny to others, but to me they might seem extremely funny. I won't stop laughing for a while. But many other people don't consider laughter as funny as many others do. I believe that laughter is an important part of us because it shows people around you the way you are and how you express yourself on things. Many of your friends or even your family will know what type of person you are and how silly you can get to be sometimes. That's the reason why I think it's a great idea to do around, just have some fun and laugh.  Now talking about relationships between people. Do you think that laughter can be an important part of any relationship, or how could it help us (in what ways)? Well, yes, I do think that laughter can be extremely important in many relationships we have with people. You get to know, and others get to know about you and how you are. Even though many relationships that we have with our friends, family, or with new people we meet, I believe that laughter tells you how a person is and how that person reacts to what other people do or tell them. Laughter expresses how that person is and whether they are fun people to be around. Laughter even tells you if that person has a lot of humor, just a little, or doesn't have any humor at all.

@CAPS4 fills the air around us with pure, unadulterated happiness and joy, like a gentle breeze carrying the sweet scent of flowers. @CAPS4 brings warm memories of loved ones that are close to us, memories that are as vivid as a well - painted picture, and adds a splash of hope to those who need @CAPS4. That is basically an everyday thing for me and my sister. My sister and I can't stare at each other for even a minute. That the kind of laughter that two people that are so close to each other get, the kind that you don't need a reason to laugh but you end up laughing for no reason at all. @CAPS3 shows the connection two people have with each other the type where you know what the other person is thinking. Laughter can come from old memories of family gatherings for the holidays, friendships we made when we were in school, memories of our childhood and how things we thought then were in style and cool are now things we look back into and laugh at, by being a little surprised, and can also be The fact that we know someone by heart.

Laughter I laugh every single day. I feel a wide range of different emotions when I am laughing. Some of the emotions are happiness, sadness, and pain. I use laughter to let my emotions be clearly seen. When I laugh, I usually feel happy afterwards, unless I am crying because I am hurt. When I am sad, I tend to laugh and smile a lot to hide the pain I am feeling because I don't want people to see me sad all the time and think I am playing the sad card to get attention. When I am sad, I tend to rely on laughter to get me through my day because if I didn't have laughter, I would have people asking what was wrong all day and it would drive me crazy. When I am angry, the only way I can laugh is if a friend or family member is trying to make me happy or if I am reminiscing of fun times I've had. It makes me genuinely happy when I laugh and brightens my day when I am angry. I also laugh at things people say to me even though they hurt my feelings when they said it, because I don't want them to know they hurt me. When I am happy, all I do is smile and laugh. I firmly believe that every single person needs some laughter in their life to be truly happy. Laughter is like a warm light in the darkness of life, always there to bring a bit of cheer.

I was really shy and didn't have much friends. One day in class some of the popular kids actually came over and started talking to me. Later that day she came up to me really upset and couldn't understand why I would do that to her. I told her I was sorry and that I only did it to make myself popular and seem funny to other kids. Laughter is a key to any happy and successful relationship in my opinion. It can break the ice in an akward situation or help you become closer to someone. Some people have said that laughter is the shortest distance between two people, and that laughter is the best medicine. I believe that both of those statements are true. One time in particular that I remember laughter really bringing me closer together with other people is when I was camping with a few of my friends. It was three years ago in the middle of @DATE1 and we were all sleeping outside under the stars. We had all been talking about pretty serious stuff, family and friend problems and just sharing our hardships in general with eachother. I didn't really have much to complain about, I had a pretty average family that I loved along with good friends. However that evening I was learning some interesting but disturbing information about my friends home life. She started to talk about how her parents don't care and how they are both alcoholics, I could tell by her tone of voice how painful admitting this information was for her. The mood had suddenly changed from discussing light issues to a serious, emotional conversation. She continued to tell me how alone she felt sometimes and how she just always wished she could be with her friends because we always have a good time.   After she told me all of this we laid in silence for a while. Neither of us were asleep but I had no idea what to say. I mean how could anything I say make that situation better or help her to feel better. While we had been having this conversation our other friend had run back to the car to grab sodas and go to the bathroom. We heard her saying our names and searching for us in the dark. All of a sudden she knew where we were, she had tripped over the edge of our sleeping bag fell on us and spilled a bunch of fizzy grape soda all over our faces. Normally we would have been angry but we all thought this was hysterical. While in the midst of laughing like crazy people I looked at my friend who had just recently told me her painful story, now she was crying from laughing so hard and I knew that a little laughter had brought us closer.  That is a memory that I will never forget, it was an experience where I feel laughter has played a major role in making a relationship more comfortable and close. Similar experiences have occured throughout my whole life. Laughter is a common ground, where all people can relate to one another. Maybe it brings people closer together because when you are legitimatley laughing you are so caught up in it that you forget about everything else. All of your problems disappear.
