Laughter is a huge part of building friendships, relationships, and partnerships. Right from the moment you are born, you know how to laugh; it's the only innate ability we possess from the start. For me, laughter is the key that unlocks the door to friendship. If I can make someone burst into laughter, we're already on a closer footing than when we first exchanged greetings. As an example, when I started working at the daycare I'm at now, getting the other teachers to laugh was like a secret handshake that signaled their acceptance of me as part of the team. On my first day, I walked into the daycare feeling extremely nervous. They sent me to the preschool classroom, and I'm pretty sure my boss could sense my jitters, which made me let out a nervous laugh. That simple laugh made me feel welcome and gave me the feeling that we could become good friends. The children in that classroom were a constant source of amusement. Their innocent antics and silly behavior never failed to make me laugh. When working with kids, you quickly realize that if you can make them laugh or show that you appreciate their jokes, they are more likely to trust you. And with that trust, you can create a comfortable and safe environment for them. Gaining someone's trust can be a challenging task, but if you manage to earn it from the very beginning, it's relatively easy to maintain. However, it's also incredibly easy to lose. When someone is feeling down in the dumps, a simple laugh can work wonders. Laughter is like a powerful medicine that can heal emotional wounds and lift spirits when nothing else seems to work. It's safe to say that making people laugh comes naturally to me. I'm just good at it, and jokes seem to flow effortlessly from my lips. When you laugh, it has a magical effect on your mood and the atmosphere around you. It lightens the load and makes everything seem better. In fact, laughing is not only good for your mental health but also has physical benefits. It's a form of exercise that can boost your immune system and reduce stress. When I'm at work and the kids start laughing, it has an immediate positive impact on me, even on the worst days. Being around happy and laughing people is contagious; it makes me feel better about myself and the world. And there's nothing quite as adorable as the laughter of babies. Their innocent and carefree giggles are like little rays of sunshine that can brighten up even the darkest of days. Laughter truly is a precious gift that enriches our lives in countless ways.

Laughter, joy and togetherness on an idyllic summer day. One of my favorite summer traditions is the visit to the house of our dear friends, the Johnsons. They live on eighty forested and meadowed acres outside of a quaint, old town. Their small green house overlooks brown fields and a blue pond, with tall trees forming a beautiful backdrop. We arrive mid - morning, full of anticipation. We either find our friends in the house or encounter them tromping out of the woods to meet us, shovels, chainsaws and other trail - building implements in their hands. After the customary hello and how - have - you - been, we often wander around the yard, exclaiming at the new fruit trees or hearing stories about the latest tenants of the birdhouses. During the hottest part of the day, we head for the shade of the lush national park woods. A short walk will bring us to a trail. I love walking among the sun - streaked ferns and fallen logs, treading carefully on the rickety bridges over burbling streams, bouncing confidently on the sturdy new bridges, and trying to avoid the dogs as they galumph in and out of the water. Mr. Johnson knows all about the flora and fauna of the region, so we get a constant stream of interesting knowledge as we hike. He also, of course, has to tell us about the trees he's planted -- a redwood here (look how well it's doing! A foot since last fall!) and a douglas fir over there (not as well. That big redwood is shading it too much). One of the best parts of the hike is when we see the dead - end section of trail that my family helped construct three years ago. We always walk to the end of it and discuss where it could go from there -- over the stream or beside it, or up the hill and if so, where would the switchbacks be? could you really bike up a trail like that? After our walk, we arrive back at the house, sweaty and talkative. Then it's time to put on swimsuits and jump in the pond! They recently built a dock that we can jump off of -- a great improvement over wading in from the edge. We swim for the majority of the afternoon, racing from one end of the pond to the other, splashing on innertubes, having pondweed - throwing battles. Finally we get tired and sit by the side of the pond, drying off in the warm sun. By evening, dinner is ready. Laura usually makes salmon, accompanied by a plethora of delicious side dishes. We drag chairs out to the hill above the pond and enjoy a leisurely supper. From the hill, we can see turtles and birds on the pond, bugs over the fields, and more birds swooping through the air feasting on the aforementioned bugs. After the meal, we haul chairs and dishes back to the house and sit on the porch into the night. Mr. Johnson's favorite part of the day is at dusk, when the sun is at just the right angle to show all the bugs swirling through the air. At one point, all the bugs gather together and create a tornado, twisting upwards into the darkening sky, and then -- they're gone, until the next summer day. It's an incredible spectacle; thousands of tiny insects disappearing at one swoop. The best thing about these days is the friendship and comradery we have with this wonderful family. The parents knew each other long before us kids were born, so we have a lot to talk about; Mr. Johnson is very interested in science topics, and he always finds a way to bring up the latest article he read. And, as with all great friends, we laugh constantly. I consistently get hiccups at least three times just when we're lounging on the porch after our busy summer day. Even on the most serious topics, my dad or the Johnson boys can find a joke to make, usually "politically incorrect" but always very funny. Now don't even get me started on the summer camping trips, winter ski trips or autumn cider pressing we do with the Johnsons. These shared experiences filled with laughter and joy are the memories that make life truly special.

What the heck is her problem," is what I thought as I glanced over and the new girl gave me a nasty look. Everyone in the class obviously thought the new girl was weird. She had a killer look in her eyes. I observed the way she glared at others in the room, and how her facial expression never changed. "What's up," my cousin, Sarah, asked while staring at the new girl, who was, of course, the center of everyone's curiosity. I glanced over at the new girl and then back at the classroom. "Come on! She can't hear us," Sarah whispered. Sarah's whispers weren't exactly as quiet as she thought. The new girl could probably hear everything we were saying. I glanced over at her again, and I noticed behind those cold eyes, she seemed kinda lonely and sad. I guess it's possible; she has been the talk of the whole sixth - grade class since she arrived about three days ago. "Hello! Taylor? Are you there?" Sarah was now in my face and blocking my view of the new girl. "She does look tough on the outside, but maybe she is actually a nice person," is what I said, but I knew it would not satisfy Sarah at all. "Nice? Definitely not. Her parents probably belong to some mafia or something. She gives off that type of aura." "We shouldn't judge someone based on their looks," I responded. Sarah gave me a sort of confusing look. "I mean, we never know unless we ask." "Well, if you're such the expert on this, why don't you go sit with her at lunch, and ask her." Oh man. There was no way I could possibly do that. I know I did say not to judge someone based on their appearance, but she looks like if I even open my mouth to speak to her she will kick me in the shins. What a predicament this is. "Aren't you the one who wants to get to know her? You ask." This one won't pass by Sarah either. "Really? No way. We already decided you were going to ask. You can't back out now," she argued. Sarah is a very stubborn girl, and though she likes to pick on me, she really is a nice person. Also, despite her obnoxious exterior she has a lot of friends, unlike myself who is shy. "Fine," I muttered. I had to give in. No matter what I say, I am going to have to face the new girl. "That's what I thought. This is a good opportunity to make a new friend. I am just helping you out." She had a mischievous grin on her face. I glanced over at the new girl one last time, and then at the clock. It was 10:30 in the morning, give or take a minute or two since I am nearsighted, but lunch is at 12:00. I couldn't pay attention at all during class. I was too busy playing out possible scenes that might occur at lunch. Maybe she isn't mean, maybe she is actually nice, and people are just misunderstanding her, including me. That aside, I don't even know what to say; I can't just casually walk up, sit down in front of her, look her in the eye, smile and say "Hi. How are you?" The impossible is just impossible and people should just accept it, in fact it should actually be a fundamental law. I looked over at the clock again, it was now 11:30 and still ticking. "Thirty minutes," Sarah said in some type of singing tone. I sighed. "Nervous? I kept watching you during class. Looked like you were going to jump through that window and run away at any second." She laughed. My seat was by the window, and that option had not slipped my mind. "I have no clue what I am going to say," I finally said. "Just say anything that won't offend her. Ask about her hobbies or what she likes. Talk about school even," she replied. "It's time. Go." Everyone piled out of the class room and into the cafeteria. After I got my lunch, I started walking toward the table the new girl was at; no one was around her, no surprise there. "Hi, can I sit here," I asked. My voice was kinda shaky and I thought I was about to have a heart attack from nervousness and from surprise at what she said. "By all means, go ahead," she smiled. Wow, she is really cute when she smiles. I smiled back and sat down. I created a conversation by introducing myself and asking how she was and how she liked the school. To my surprise we actually shared a common interest, and bonded. She was laughing. I was laughing. We were laughing together. After that day, and even still today we are the best of friends. That slight feeling of laughter is so nostalgic, it's almost indescribable. How something so minor such as laughter, or even a little giggle, can bring anybody together to form a simple bond, a friendship. Laughter truly has the power to break down barriers and create connections.

It is often said that laughter can bring people together. I hold that knowledge to be true. We've all laughed at one point in our lives, whether it was in a group of people, or just laughing alone and having a great time. Reality is we are all connected to each other in one very simple way, we all have laughed in our lives. Laughter to everyone means something different. To me, laughter can mean that I'm happy and full of life and other times it can simply mean that I feel I really don't know what to do. There's one time though that it meant both. It was a cold, and rainy Saturday day in November. I was with my friends watching movies. When I'm with my friends typically that means we're talking about the latest thing, guys, hair, and whatever else. "Oh my gosh, Taylor!" We heard Lisa scream as Jenny and I walked into my room. "Oh boy." I thought, "Here we go again. I knew it would be a mistake to have both of them here at the same time." Jenny and I exchanged glances, I knew she had the same thought going through her head. "What, what happened this time?" Jenny sighed as we entered the room only to see the two of them going at each other, violently tugging each others hair, slapping each other, they did everything imaginable to each other before I lost it. I hate seeing my friends fight at each other the way they were. "Stop!" I finally yell. "This is what we're going to do. You," I pointed to Taylor, "go and sit over there." Taylor walked out of my room and sat down. "What, calm down. Can't you two just relax and enjoy this time and act like you two are friends? For at least another six hours?" I looked at each of them, they nodded in response. "Okay, let's just finish the rest of this movie, or play a nice quiet game." I sighed, hoping the worst was over. Taylor walked back into my room, and laid on my bed, we continued through the movie peacefully. "Aren't you just a comical genius?" Lisa said staring at the screen. We started laughing at her because her eyes seemed to be stuck on only the actor. "Oh my gosh, Lisa!" Taylor said laughing. "Who's calling who

Laughter is one of the most important elements in one's life. If you're down, one smile, or laugh, causes your body to send messages throughout you body making you feel better. Scientists also say that it takes more muscles to frown than smile. I believe that this is true, because in order to frown, you have to make your whole body look like it's frowning, like your shoulders and your face, but only a little smile shows people that you're happy. In that way, my family is extremely beneficial to each other. Everyday when we're having a conversation, someone will bring up a story, or movie quote that they were reminded of and say it out loud to everybody with just the right accent so that it sounds exactly like the movie, and cause everyone to laugh. For example, every now and again, my brother or sister will bring up a quote from @PERSON1 or @PERSON2, two comedians we really enjoy listening to, and every person in the room would pitch in with hilarious quotes they said and this could go on all night. Or, a little while ago, my favorite movie wasGet @CAPS1 because it was quite entertaining, so we would have rampages over supper or just randomly in the kitchen quoting that one movie for at least half an hour and the room would be filled with non-stop laughter. On the other hand, someone will make a random comment because they heard wrong, or just don't understand. Like when we were having a dinner party at my house. My family and our guests were sitting at the table just finished eating when we got onto the topic of @CAPS2 @CAPS3 because my little sister was learning about them in school. We verbally completed the train of "Which @CAPS4 ruled @CAPS5, who they came from, and @CAPS5 they're other names were". But according to my little sister, we missed one. So, out of the blue comes "@CAPS5 about @CAPS6?!". Her intentions were about the @CAPS4, but I believe everyone in the room heard "@CAPS5 about @CAPS9 @CAPS10?!", until we paused for a second and processed @CAPS5 she meant, and we all laughed and she had no idea why until she stopped to think about it herself. Our family has good times filled with laughter and jokes, but there are also a few very depressing times. About four years ago, an incident happened with my next door neighbor that caused him to be brutally attacked and pass away on our door step. He was very dear to my family and the rest of the cul-de-sac we live in, and for him to die like that was extremely unexpected and terrible to wake up to in the middle of night. After that, there was a period of not very much laughter and fun because we were all haunted by this horror. But, we all knew that his spirit was there to protect us, and so whenever we thought of that, there was a gap between the mourning of his loss, only to be filled in with happiness and laughter. I believe that my family and I have a really tight connection between each other, because we're so funny. There's never any stress between us, but always a calm sense of familiarity and bonding. Someone once said "Laughter is the shortest distance between two people." I believe that, whoever that person is, is right. Even between two strangers that run into each other on the street, if they stop and have a conversation, and one person cracks a joke causing them both to laugh, it's the spark to an immediate connection, and they could become friends for a long time. This is one of the most important values that people have, and most people overlook how much it really matters to humanity.

The human brain is an incredibly intricate piece of work. It's truly the kingdom that governs our lives. It has the power to infuriate us, guide us towards the right path, offer invaluable help, and unfortunately, sometimes even destroy us. Our brains can make our bodies feel anything it desires. It's really something else entirely. One of the most valuable capabilities our brains possess is a sense of humor, which manifests as laughter. It's the ability to not take life too seriously for a moment. That metaphorical light switch in our body that causes our brain to reach a state of uncontrollable happiness. Laughter is our brain's only way of coping with the world, scoping out the comical events life has to offer us. I am personally one of those people who finds everything in life funny, or will find a way to make it funny. I am hardly ever serious nor do I take things seriously. The same goes for my friends; we are always the ones having a great time because we make life interesting. Maybe it's the gnarly facial expressions we exchange with one another, or perhaps we just be funny - looking. Either way, we have a strong sense of humor. That's what life is about, finding true happiness with people who fill our life with joy. @PERSON1 said, "live simply, so that others can simply live." I believe we all can with a little sense of humor. Last year, a couple of friends and I went to Mission Ridge for a weekend to go snowboarding. We had it made; our own hotel suite with two king - sized beds and a plasma TV. @PERSON2 and I slept on one bed and @PERSON3 on the other. We all have always gotten along perfectly and have shared the biggest laughs together. Nothing could come between any of us. Other than a little midnight prank. When we look back on the past, everything seems to have had a deeper meaning. When we grow older, however, we see the world with new eyes. We see the truth, harsh, stripped of the glossy film that hid it. Laughter helps us see the joy once again, to remember it is there. When is the last time you got lost in laughter? Studies have shown that laughter releases feel-good chemicals in the body. It can add years to a life because, believe it or not, our bodies like to be happy. Laughter is a highly addictive and contagious drug and the best part is that it is free, legal and healthy! Laughter makes us feel better in times of need and brings us closer together. Through whatever is happening in our lives, laughter is one of the only things that can distract us from the pain and stress. As life gets more and more complicated as we grow older, we find that laughter is harder to come by, but no less needed. I remember a time when I was excited every day to go to school. I loved to arrive at the familiar classroom and see everyone who made my days brighter. We would tell jokes and reminisce of fond memories and in the process would make brand new ones for the future. Life was simpler, the worst of our worries surrounded the desperation to be older, to shed our youth and step out of the powerless shells we were imprisoned in. Of only we knew what that really meant. Smiles were not hard to come by and we all enjoyed the simplicity that our lives had to offer. Through all the memories and laughter, I began to realize that love existed aside from movies and family, the love that you find for a friend that you treasure. Laughter was the key variable, revealed in understanding my relationships. When you learn how to fall deeply in love as a kid, that patience and trust can get you through ever day of the rest of your life. All we need to do is to is remember not to forget. The simplicity of childhood is what makes it so precious. Unfortunately as we all grown older, the future looms over our heads, casting a shadow over the things we cherish. There is a predetermined way we are supposed to live our lives that for some reason, erases the plausibility of our true aspirations. Laughter gives way to sighs and tears while dimples are forgotten and replaced with furrowed brows. Everything in adulthood orbits around the office and is held to a nine to five obligation. Businessmen walk past looking like identical mindless penguins. Where did all the fun go? It seems that the pleasure is evaporated with every passing day. We no longer get to know our colleagues around a circle of carpet squares. Instead we are confined to our felt paddock and swivel chair. All the stress makes us forget to laugh, but we simply can't forget. Laughter is the amnesia that makes the cubicle into a fort and the chair into a rocket ship that will take us from our fort to follow our dreams.  So when is the last time you got lost in laughter? Make it now. Take the pen and turn it into a quill. Step out of your cubicle and find the world that you enjoy. Laugh every day because life is too short to forget.

Suddenly, our conversation was interrupted by a brisk knock on the door downstairs. We looked at each other and smiled. In that smile, I saw a real person smiling at me with real pleasure showing through. Very much unlike previous encounters with kids at school. Downstairs, we said our good - byes to one another. As the new, cool @DATE3 air began to rush through the opened door, I reached out to hug her. To my surprise, she took my gesture and ran back to hug me. Her hair smelled of hair products and powder, a smell very unfamiliar but surprisingly comforting.  Once she was gone for the night, I began to think. I really liked @PERSON1 and I wanted to see her again soon. I felt accomplished in some way and fulfilled to have this bright future opportunity brought to me so easily and perfectly. That night, I stayed up later than usual, thinking about the next time I could see her, how she had looked, and trying to understand how we could get along so well.  Despite these questions haunting the edge of my every thought, I slept happily, thinking of the next time I would get to see her. All of those @DATE1 questions and concerns have been answered in the @DATE1, and we are the closest of friends. Not long after we started hanging out more often, we began to like one another a lot. One of my favorite parts about our relationship is how people get so confused to see us two so different yet so close to one another. I have thanked my mom over these @DATE1 for many things, but mostly for what she has done for my relationship. If it hadn't of been for her, my life would probably have been much darker. No one on that cold night expected this one meeting to evolve into our beautiful relationship. Laughter is an extremely vital part of a relationship whether it is being built or being kept up. Thanks to the laughter that excelled our conversation @DATE1 @DATE1 ago, I have had the best experience I could have ever asked for.

Laughing is one of the things we do best. @PERSON1 and I talk almost every single day and never get tired of laughing. We talk about everything, and even if it is the saddest thing in the world, we will be able to make it funny in a way. It's just one of those unique things we do.  As best friends, it's our job to make each other feel better. And if one calls the other crying, it's their job to make the other laugh. And if it is funny for both of us, we know it was a job well done.  In @DATE3, my uncle died. I called her crying my eyes out. She said, "Everything is going to be okay and just think of all the good memories I had of him." One of the only ones I could think of was the funniest story of my life. Even though I was still crying, through those tears there was laughter, and I knew my uncle would want me to laugh and he was right there laughing with me.  @PERSON1 and I met @DATE1, at @ORGANIZATION1, where we spent a week out of our busy schedule to get to know new people and get closer to @CAPS1. Yet when we hit those differences and the other disagrees, it starts a fight. But fights just bring people closer together. About a month after @PERSON1 had gotten in a bad car accident, we went to Skate World. @PERSON1 was on crutches, so she couldn't skate, but that didn't stop her from having fun and making the whole evening full of laughter. By the end of the night, she got almost everyone in our group dancing up on the stools. I don't regret one thing that happened that evening. It was the most I had laughed in about a year. We were dancing and screaming for about three hours before one of the parents got there, and after that, we all went home. That is an evening I will never forget. A girl that was recovering from a horrible car accident made the best out of what she had!  When things don't work out the way we wanted, we just go on with life wishing that it had happened differently. But when we look back a couple of years down the road, we will see that it was just fine, and it will just make us laugh. Laughing has always made me feel better, and knowing that I can make someone with a difficult life laugh until they are about to pee makes me feel good. It makes me feel like I have done something good with my life, that I was willing to help @PERSON1 with her struggles. To me, that makes this life, a life worth living. And I know looking back in a few years, we will both laugh. Laughing is a good way to get rid of fear, anger, and stress. It makes us think of all the good times we have had in our life and lets us know that we had fun in our life. Though we fight, in the end, I don't think anyone will be able to tear @PERSON1 and I apart, with all the laughter that is shared between us. We are true friends.

Someone once said, "Laughter is the shortest distance between two people" and I couldn't agree more. Laughing with people has been the greatest

She tells the teacher that she was the one that made me laugh so she thought she deserved detention too. So she got what she wanted, detention! I love laughing with my friends and the feeling of your abs hurting from laughing is awesome!Live your live, laugh as much as you can, and love those that mean the most to you.

We all understand the numerous benefits of laughter. Laughter can vividly show emotions, and it can even go the extra mile of strengthening a friendship or a relationship. To many people, laughter is an extremely important part of any relationship. First, laughter is highly significant in a friendship. If you can't have a fun and happy friendship, then you won't have a truly good friendship. Building up a friendship can be quite challenging at times. It can range from having a hearty laugh together to not laughing at all, which can help determine the nature of your friendship. Having a friendship with someone is one of the most wonderful feelings. Knowing that you have someone you can whole - heartedly trust, freely talk to, who will be there for you, and most importantly, laugh with is an amazing feeling. Also, laughter is crucial in every childhood memory. Thinking back to when I was little, I was constantly laughing. Even though my mom and dad left me and my brothers, I always had my grandparents, brothers, cousins, and even aunts and uncles to keep me occupied and always have a great time. I believe laughter is an essential thing during childhood because it's healthy, you can learn to keep others' spirits high and keep them laughing and happy, and it's always beneficial to have a strong, fun, and happy relationship with your family. Last, laughter is very important in a romantic relationship. I think it will build character in your relationship and shows everyone that you're truly happy with the person you're with. Laughter will also build a good and strong, healthy relationship and will lead to positive outcomes. If you think about it, laughter is probably the most important aspect in a relationship because when you decide to marry the person you're with, it can prevent divorce and constant fighting, and you will have a strong relationship. So, therefore, after pointing out that laughter is important regardless of age, gender, in friendships, childhood, or relationships, you should see that my point is that laughter is important no matter the situation. It helps build a strong - willed person and also builds character within yourself, making life more enjoyable.

Have you ever found yourself in an awkward situation and managed to lighten the mood with a hearty laugh? I have, and many others have too. I've discovered that laughter makes people feel more at ease, which allows them to be their genuine selves. Although laughter may not work in this way for everyone, here are some ways it has benefited me. I was at a homeschoolers' group in @LOCATION1 several years ago and didn't know anyone there. After wandering around for a while, this girl struck up a conversation with me. She was really funny, and being able to laugh with her made me feel more comfortable, and I ended up having a great time. I just had to find the right person. Another instance where laughter might have been helpful was when I was invited to a birthday party of a friend I hadn't seen in over two years. There were several others there whom I hadn't seen in a long time. The whole visit was quite awkward, and all I wanted to do was blend in. I tried to act like everyone else, but if I had laughed and been more at ease, I would have been able to show my true self. When I first started at public school, I was nervous about meeting new people and wondering what kind of people they would be. After about a week, people began to see my personality, the funny, happy, and laugh - loving person inside, and that really clicked with a lot of them. That's why I'm friends with the people I'm friends with now, because our similar personalities meshed well. Laughter has brought me to a great place in life. Laughter can make a lot of people happy and comfortable in awkward situations. It can encourage people to show their true personalities and attract like - minded individuals. I firmly believe that the world would be a much happier place if everyone could embrace laughter.

Get up kids," my mother said as she was rushing to pack her things and get ready. I knew precisely what I had done wrong; I hadn't set my alarm on my phone for six am. Instead, I set it for six pm, and now we were running late. Thinking to myself, I quickly started packing my clothes for the week: six pairs of pants, six pairs of shirts, six pairs of underwear, and six pairs of socks. I placed my bag next to the front door and then realized it was right beside the other bag I had packed the day before. My sisters were even more of a hassle. As girls, they took forever putting on their makeup and straightening their hair. Finally, everyone was packed, but it was already seven am, and we were supposed to be at @LOCATION2 by then, yet we were still sitting at our house. Once my sisters were done and we were in the car, we could finally head off to @LOCATION3. Our family had been planning this trip for a month, and now it was @DATE2! I was really excited to go. By this point, I had butterflies in my stomach. We lived in @LOCATION1, and we were only halfway through @LOCATION2, with eight out of ten hours still left to reach my mom's cousin's house. I fell asleep for the first two hours of the journey, and now I couldn't sleep anymore. I was stuck in the back seat with nothing to do, so I started singing the never - ending song. "This is the song that never ends, and it goes on and on my friends." "Stop it," my sister in the front seat yelled at me very harshly. I didn't stop, and she yelled at me again to stop singing. For a third time, I annoyed my sister, and she responded by punching my arm. For some reason, I started to laugh. It didn't hurt, and I thought it was funny that she hit me for just singing a silly song. I had a really odd laugh, so my little sister started laughing because I was laughing. Then my older sister quite angrily screamed at me and my younger sister to be quiet. My older sister punched me again, trying to get me to stop laughing. By now, I was laughing so hard that I could hardly breathe, and my face was turning a deep shade of purple. It was truly hilarious when my mom couldn't hold it back any longer and started cracking up and laughing with me and my younger sister. My mom wears dentures, and she was laughing so hard that they almost fell out of her mouth while she was driving, which made us laugh even harder. My stomach felt like it was going to burst from all the laughter. My older sister, now turning a dark shade of blue from yelling at us so much to shut up, threw her arms in the air and let out one last scream before throwing herself back into her seat with a very angry look on her face. Over the next minute, we all stopped laughing and were quiet for the next hour until we stopped to eat. We enjoyed our lunch and then got back on the road because we still had a long trip ahead. I soon felt tired and fell asleep in the most uncomfortable position you could imagine in a car. I had my head against the door, my arm over the front passenger seat, one of my legs on the seat, and the other in between the driver and passenger seats. I thought I was pretty lucky to have slept most of the way, as we only had about a half - hour left until we reached my mom's cousin's house. We were in the middle - west of @LOCATION3, and the mountains were incredibly beautiful. They were full of color and life, with gigantic trees swaying in the wind and squirrels scurrying from tree to tree, burying nuts in the ground. It was the farthest I had ever been from where I lived in @LOCATION1. I was glad to be on this trip with my family. My stay in @LOCATION3 was a bit of a blur. I can hardly remember most of what happened there. I played video games and ate unhealthy junk food with a neighbor kid around my age. My mom was the happiest of us all to get away from @LOCATION1 for the weekend. She hadn't seen her cousin in about three years and was really happy to see her. It was now @DATE1, and it was time to return to our normal lives. So, we packed up our stuff and headed back home. I was doing great at not talking and annoying my sister for the first minute or so. Then, I started to sing the never - ending song again. I have never laughed so hard in my life, and it made the long journey back a bit more bearable.

The members of my immediate family are well - known for being incredibly clumsy and easily startled. Broken dishes are a regular sight in our house, along with spilled drinks, stubbed toes, and blood - curdling screams every time the toaster pops up. Although all of us are accustomed to these things, not everyone around us is, which can lead to some interesting encounters. Many people find amusement in jabbing me in the sides just to hear me scream and laugh when I trip over the slightest crack in the floor. Even though it can get irritating at times, it can also give me a reason to overcome my pride and laugh at myself, thus relieving any tensions I might have been feeling in a social setting. For example, a few years ago, I was staying with my @CAPS1 @CAPS2 troop at @LOCATION1. Any situation involving large groups of people can be intimidating, but it's even more terrifying when the group consists of girls aged four to eighteen, with only a few adults around to prevent the girls from getting into serious fights. To make matters worse, where I was staying, a hybrid between a cabin and a tent, most of the girls were in middle school, and needless to say, we didn't always see eye to eye. Despite the fact that we weren't all the best of friends, there were moments when we could put aside our petty differences, like who was popular and who wasn't, and enjoy the time we had to chat and joke around with people in similar life situations. On one such occasion, I was trying to make my bed on one of the top bunks. I was in the process of stretching the sheet over the hard, petrified mattress that might have possibly been around since @NUM1 @CAPS3.C. Being my usual forgetful self, I decided to lean against the wall behind me for balance, completely forgetting that there was no actual wall, just a thin, cloth - like material that couldn't support my weight. The second I realized my mistake, I frantically reached out for something to hold on to and tried desperately to keep myself from falling backwards to the floor and certain injury. Just milliseconds before I would have crashed into the hard wood floor, I managed to grab hold of one of the bars on the side of the bed and hung on tightly, swinging back and forth like a pendulum. Finally, I let go and sort of gracefully propelled myself onto the bed below mine. It took a very long time for the laughter to die down. In that short period, cliques, biases, and grudges were all forgotten as we became not just a random group of girls in a room but a united group with our own unique strengths and weaknesses, passions, and flaws. Though the adolescent years are extremely tough and there are numerous times when you feel like the loneliest person in the world, it's always reassuring to know that there are others who laugh and cry just like you and experience many of the same joys and embarrassments. One of the most essential skills to acquire is the ability to laugh at yourself from time to time and be vulnerable in front of others. We may not all be the same, but we all share the basic desires for love, acceptance, and laughter, which can bring us closer together.

I still didn't know much, but I did learn that my brother's leg had suffered a compound fracture. Can you imagine life without laughter? Life without laughter is plain, dull, and utterly boring. Laughter is an incredibly important part in life. There would truly be nothing to look forward to if laughing didn't exist. Laughter creates precious memories, strong relationships, and it fills in the awkward silence that might occur between two people.   Some people don't realize how truly important laughing is. Life without laughter is like life without water, a vital element that sustains and enriches. I think that's how important laughter really is. The quote "Laughter is the shortest distance between two people." is true, but laughing is more than just an element. It's way more important than that. Well, I guess we could all technically live without laughter, but who in their right mind would want to?   No laughter means no fun times like: swimming on a sunny day, enjoying the thrills at water parks, gliding gracefully on ice while ice skating, or dancing with abandon. Those fun things can lead to hearty laughter. Without anything fun to do, no one would look forward to tomorrow. Everyday would be a waste, if there wasn't any laughter in the world.   Some people might just think that laughing is just an element. Why is that? Laughter is important enough to be more than that. For example, water is an element because it has something to do with the earth. It stands for the vast ocean. Laughter doesn't fit in that category. Laughing has such a huge impact on our lives. Laughing makes everything ten times better. Laughing creates memories, and memories create relationships. That's why laughter is an important part in any relationship. It's amazing how the smallest thing, like a simple laugh, can make such a big difference in our lives. In conclusion, laughter is a precious gift that enriches our lives in countless ways, and we should cherish and embrace it every day.

The Power of Laughter. Laughing is a huge part of most people's everyday life. It is a very common emotion that I see hundreds of times a day. Whether it be from something as simple as a funny face made during a casual conversation, a well - told joke, a hilarious picture, and even little things people do or say can bring laughter to even the most serious of individuals. My friends and I laugh constantly. We can make something funny out of pretty much anything, be it a mundane task or a passing comment.  I think being able to laugh, and joke around are very good traits to have as a person because it makes life so much more fun and optimistic. I can't even count the number of times I have been in a complete laughing fit because of my friend Sarah. She is by far one of the funniest people I have ever met in my entire life.   Though she is extremely funny, she is not exactly the brightest crayon in the box. She asks questions after people already tell her the answer, she says exactly what I say after I say it without even noticing that I had already said it before her, and sometimes she even trips on the concrete while racing someone to her car after practice. The things she does may not be super intelligent sometimes, but they sure can give anyone a good laugh.  I remember not even a week ago I was in the car with Sarah on the way to volleyball practice, and she just belted out the wrong words to the song we were listening to. What made it even more funny was the fact that even though she knew the words were wrong she kept singing like she knew every word. At the end of the song we laughed so hard we cried. By the time we got to practice her and I had been laughing for about ten minutes straight.  During practice our coach had been explaining directions to one of the drills. She told us loud and clear to serve the ball to spots one and five diagonally. Sarah, not fully understanding the directions, decided she should ask and make sure it was all clear to her. So she put her hand up and asked, "Coach, so do we diagonally serve to spots one and five?" My whole team broke out into hysterical laughter. Sarah, who didn't understand, stood there looking confused, but when she finally understood why we were all laughing she joined in. That happened about three more times throughout our two and a half - hour practice. She even got put in front row which made us all laugh because she is very short and looked really funny next to the six - foot - one girls standing right next to her.  By the time practice was over I think we had gotten a better workout from laughing than from playing volleyball. On our way out to the car, Sarah decided she wanted to race a girl on our team to her car. The girl agreed and they took off in a dead sprint. You could see the determination to win in Sarah's face, and all of a sudden they were nowhere to be found. I ran up the stairs to see who had won, only to find Sarah face down on the ground with the girl sitting next to her laughing hysterically. I felt bad, but it was so funny I couldn't help but to laugh. We sat there laughing for a good fifteen minutes, and we laughed about it all the way home. That was the icing on the cake to one of the funniest days I have ever had.   In conclusion, laughter like this with friends not only makes our days more enjoyable but also strengthens our bonds, and these memories will stay with us for a long time.

The Humor of Laughter. Many people think that my school is just like any other. These people are very wrong. My school is very different than most. For you see, it is filled with humorous people. These people make up a lot of the bright side of my school. Where these people are you might ask? Why, they are everywhere. The best place to look is in the hallways, especially on Fridays at my school, during lunch, or after school.  Most of the people I will tell you about are friends of mine. There are also a lot of people I don't even know the names of. There is even a teacher I'll mention something about. Well enough chit - chat, let's get to it shall we?  I will first start with the teacher. I forget her name but she likes to talk with a southern accent. She is also very enthusiastic, and I do mean enthusiastic. She often says, "Let's we go!". It's very funny. I have never seen her without enthusiasm. Many of the students are really disturbed by it. It can be annoying at times but at least she's not all gloomy or other. In fact we might even need more like her at this school, as well as many others.  There is also a student who is also very enthusiastic, not all the time but quite often is he. His name is Tom. Tom is quite a jolly kid. He loves to sing. I do mean he loves to sing. Even if he doesn't know the words to the song he is singing, he will sing. People always joke about him around him. The jokes are usually mean jokes, but he puts up with them and laughs along. I really do have to give him that much credit. It would be hard for just about anyone to put up with such rude words, let alone laugh with them. But enough of that. He is very jolly and really makes you laugh, which is really great. Don't stop being funny Tom.  There is a funny pair of boys who can knock your shoes off, perhaps even literally with what they do. These two boys, named Jake and Mark, are very humorous, as well as dangerously humorous. Ever heard of a Hoberman sphere? It is a brand of a toy that is very fun for little kids, as well as big kids. This toy is shaped like a bowl. You turn it inside out, aim the rim at the ground, and drop it. When it hits the ground, it pops up into the air. Well, Jake and Mark love playing with the Hoberman sphere, so much to the point that they found a new way to play with it. Instead of hitting the ground with it, they hit each other with it! They love to hurt each other. Eventually, though, the Hoberman sphere got very worn out and tore. It needed to retire from its rough job, but Jake and Mark wouldn't let it. They just couldn't stop playing with it. Lately, though, I haven't seen them playing with it lately.  We think it might have broke. Ha ha! Never go wondering through the hallways with Lisa, even if you have a destination. Trust me on this, you don't want to! Lisa gets distracted very easily in the hallways. If she sees someone that she wants to talk to, she doesn't tell you. She just twirls around and rushes over to them. For this, always have her take the lead if you do go with her; at least you'd know when she wanders off the trail. Never the less, Lisa is still very humorous. She makes lots of random sounds. You get completely off - guard and just can't help to laugh at how weird sounding those sounds are. Grace, on the other hand, not only does sounds but also does hilarious facial expressions. She always tries to mimic the funny things her goats and pets do when she tells us about them. Together, Grace and I are very funny.  In the finals started, we were drawing such goofy pictures of each other and random things. I drew her as a stick figure going to the moon, but the moon was very far away. We cracked up! She once redrew a little comic her brother thought of more than a year or two again. In the comic, it was a very ugly man who was telling his friends that they were going to a night club, but the ugly man turned out to be a woman. During finals, there was also a guy pulling his friend through the hallways by the arm. The friend said that it was very comfy. Then, they told a teacher about it! Ha ha ha!  So you see, my school is much more than an ordinary school. You could probably call it a clown school if you wanted to. Ha ha ha ha! You would never truly know just how many ha - ha's I say a day until you visit, so come on over. We will let you join the fun, and you'll see that humor can make school a much more enjoyable place.

Everybody knows that long car rides can be both physically, and mentally exhausting. Picture a family of four: a mother, a father, and two daughters in a car. The father is behind the wheel, the mother is in the passenger seat, the older sister is on the left side of the back seat, and the younger sister on the right side. The sun is rising, and you're still on the road. The father is tired, after driving all night. The mother just woke up, yawning, and is wondering how much further until the destination. The sisters are looking out of their windows with extremely bored expressions. Even with cups of coffee to perk them up, and loud music playing, the atmosphere is still lifeless, extremely dull.  What could possibly bring up this lifeless atmosphere? My guess, a form of entertainment. As a young child, I was always on the road. Moving from place to place, because of my father's work. At the time, we were living in a state known for its snow, Minnesota. Wonderful wildlife, breathtaking views, and beautiful landscapes, untouched by man. During the long winter months, the snow covered the ground, like a thick blanket on a bed. You could wake up in the morning with two new feet of snow. Although, despite living in a cold, isolated state, the summers were extremely hot. A total twist to someone unfamiliar with Minnesota's weather.  This was around a decade ago, so the environment might've changed, but nevertheless, it is still a breathtaking, beautiful state. After coming home from school on a cool autumn day, my mother told me to start packing my room. I knew we were due to leave that autumn, but I was still hesitant on leaving my friends. Every time that we moved, I had to say a heart - breaking goodbye to the friends I knew for the few years I lived there.  I went to my room and started to pack for a long, long trip. My father came to me and told me we are moving by car. He asked my sister and I to go with him so he could pick up the uHaul. We went to check out the sizes, and the condition it was in. As usual, the trucks weren't in the best of condition for moving over a long distance, but it's better than nothing. My father drove it back home, with my sister and I, and my father started to put the packed boxes in the truck. My mother, my sister and I finished packing the rest of the boxes. The boxes with valuable, and mandatory items were stuffed in my mom's car, along with our cats in their cages.  After getting everything packed, and loaded, the hired uHaul employees drove the uHaul away to our new destination, Texas. Everyone had mixed emotions about leaving. My mother loved her neighbours, my father had some amazing coworkers, my sister and I made some spectacular friends, but we had to say our goodbyes to our friends. It's not the first time, and it's not the last time, but every time it still hurts. The times we spent together, will always be in our memories!  Off we go! To our new temporary home. Driving from Minnesota to Texas. The only thing that I didn't like, was that we had to be in Texas in less than a week. A week to drive that long way? Less stops, more driving, and no fun, or sight - seeing... a total drag!!  It was really chatty and energetic in the beginning, but everyone soon got sick of being on the road. My sister's body didn't handle it well in the beginning, and neither did mine. Half way to Texas, all conversations stopped. The atmosphere started to fade, and so did the excitement. There was absolutely nothing to do in such a small area.  I wanted to try to make the rest of the drive fun, so

Have you ever felt an incredible sense of well - being after you laughed heartily? Well, numerous studies have shown that after a good laugh, you not only experience an uplifted mood but it's also an effective way to burn some calories. One instance when I was feeling utterly down, my cousin came over and managed to make me laugh out loud. This shared laughter was a truly vital part of our relationship. She not only made that day brighter but also infused it with a burst of energy. When people don't laugh, how can they possibly have as much fun? Studies have clearly indicated that laughing does wonders for your health. It enhances a specific blood flow in your brain, which in turn helps a person to be more energetic and cheerful. It has also been shown that regular laughter can lead to a longer life span. Moreover, every time a person laughs, it aids in burning a small number of calories. If it's beneficial for you, why not laugh more often? Just think, if nobody laughed, what kind of world would this be? It would be a dull place filled with unhappy individuals, just like that time when my cousin came to visit me. One day, I was feeling extremely low and depressed. Nothing was going according to plan, and it seemed like it was going to be a terrible day. Then, all of a sudden, my cousin showed up at @ORGANIZATION1 and surprised me. We both started laughing so hard that our stomachs ached. She transformed a bad day into a really fun one. We had a movie night where we ate delicious candy and pickles all through the night. We even made up silly songs and sang them at the top of our voices. We had the most amazing time of our lives. The whole night was like one big party. I can't even imagine what would happen to everyone if none of us ever laughed. If we didn't laugh, our relationship definitely wouldn't be as strong as it is. It would seem as if we were sad or depressed all the time. If there was no laughter, I wouldn't look forward to seeing her as much as I do now. Laughing is a huge part of having fun in any relationship. It shows that you're comfortable with the person and that you're truly enjoying their company. If you've ever been in a slump and wanted to give up, you know how unfun it can be. But whether you watch a hilarious movie or have a chat with a friend that makes you laugh, you'll know the joy it brings to your life. So, laughing must be an important aspect of your life or in any relationship you have. Overall, laughing for me is one of the most crucial things a person can do to make another person feel welcome and at ease around them. It's also a great way to have fun and shed a few calories simultaneously. If you need a dose of happiness in your life, then watch a funny movie or hang out with people who can make you laugh. Laughter truly is the best medicine that can brighten up any situation.

Social @CAPS1 @CAPS2 individuals often think of laughter as a means of expressing one's emotions, almost like a distinct emotion itself. However, I perceive laughter in a different light. Laughter is a powerful form of communication. Sure, you might @MONTH1 laugh when something is genuinely funny, but the truth is that you have some control over it. So, @CAPS5 do people laugh? They laugh to convey a message; essentially, they are letting you know that what you said or did was amusing to them. Over time, laughter can build strong relationships or even initiate them, because when someone laughs at you or with you, you are sharing a common experience. I know that laughter is an important part of my life because, without it, I would have never met my best friend. When I started sixth grade, I was extremely scared. I was terrified that I would lose all of my old friends and become one of those kids who sits alone in the cafeteria every day, longing to have someone to share their greasy pizza with. Of course, I was overreacting, but the thought constantly lingered in my mind during the first few days. Soon, I even noticed that my friends were finding new people to hang out with, and I began to feel like I was becoming the outcast I had feared. Then I met him. He was a skater kid with dark hair that fell past his eyes and pale, almost white skin. I was with one of my few friends, @CAPS3, when I saw him riding his skateboard near the front of the school. I didn't think much of him at first, except that he had some of the coolest shoes I had ever seen. We often think that laughter is just an emotion, but in all actuality, it's practically a way of life. We use laughter to cheer people up when they're sad or to get out of trouble when we've done something wrong. People do stupid things like telling silly jokes or making funny faces just to make others laugh. I personally think laughter is a reason to live, and that everyone needs more of it in their daily lives. I have always been the type to make everyone laugh and feel better, and I would always put myself in a bit of pain, like getting a scolding from an adult, just to cheer someone else up. When I was a child, my friend would always be picked on at school, for no good reason really. And I wasn't the type to take action, or try and get back at someone. But that all changed when my friend came home covered with food, crying before school was even let out. She told me that these girls threw their lunches at her and were calling her names. So the next day I went to school with her in the morning, and I took @CAPS1 filled with chocolate milk, a thick smoothie, egg yolks, and soured milk. When she pointed the girls out to me, I grabbed the balloon with chocolate milk and threw it right at one of them, and it hit her in the chest. She started screaming that her clothes were designer, like someone would actually care. I looked at my friend's face; she was in awe - shock, but I could tell she was trying to hold back her joy because she knew I was not yet finished. I then threw one with egg yolks in it, and it got in a girl's hair. Her scream was so loud it was earsplitting. The smoothie - filled one got two of the girls who were hugging to try and keep each other safe (or trying to use each other as a shield), but it wouldn't work with my throws. They started to freak out and run to the others, which was a bad idea because they were all huddled together trying to figure out who it was. By the time they figured it out, it was too late. I was already throwing the biggest balloon filled with soured milk at them, and they couldn't get out of there fast enough. It landed in between all of them and exploded when they had turned to see what it was that was thrown. It covered all of them, and they started screaming so loud that the school officials started coming out of the building to see what all the screaming was about. I could see every one of the kids who saw the whole show coming over to me. They started to tell me how amazing it was and how funny the girl's reactions were. Some kids were still on the ground laughing so hard they couldn't breathe. Some thanked me and told me that these girls had been picking on them for a while. I looked at my friend who was on the verge of tears, but this time they were tears of happiness. She ran over and hugged me so tightly I thought the air was going to be squeezed out of me. It's been ten years since then, and I still talk to my friend. She even occasionally calls me if she's having trouble with someone at school. As for the girls? I haven't heard anything about them since they all got transferred to different schools. I guess laughter, in a way, is the source of all joy in our lives, and it helps people become closer than ever before. My friend still says that it was the best day of her life. Some of the other kids who witnessed the event go to high school with her now, and all ask how I am and want to see me do something like it again. Unfortunately, I had to turn them down and tell them they have to learn how to deal with their own bullies themselves. I imagine that some of them have come up with very creative ways to get back at people by going off of what I did. Laughter and a bit of courage can really make a difference in someone's life.

Laughter is an essential component to any relationship, as it can erase any previous uneasy feelings and has a strong tendency to bring two people together. This phenomenon stays true whether the individuals involved are in

Laughter is an important part of my life. The best way to pass the time is laughing whole - heartedly with friends and family. Think back on all the fun times you've had. If you do, you'll find that in most of them, you were laughing out loud. That's because laughter and fun go hand in hand. Everyone likes to have fun; therefore, everyone likes to laugh. Laughing is good for you in many ways. It keeps you genuinely happy, helps maintain truly healthy relationships with others, and it effectively relieves stress. Also, a lot of people laugh when they're nervous, and I'm one of these people. Especially when you're put in an awkward situation, like when you have to do a speech in front of the class. I remember my first speech in high school; it's one of the scariest things I've ever done. It was my sophomore year, and I slouched down in my chair and tried to get as low as possible so the teacher couldn't see me. I wouldn't make any eye - contact with her either. I put my back - pack in front of me in order to block her view. Every time she'd look around the room to pick another person to go, I'd hold my breath and hope it wasn't me. Every time it wasn't me, I would breathe out in relief. Finally, it was getting down to a few people, and I knew my doom would soon await me. I decided to take a chance and peek over my back - pack to see who the teacher was looking at for her next victim. What I saw when I looked at her was her eyes meet mine. I tried to hide behind my back - pack again, but it was too late. She had already started to call my name out. What should I do? I thought to myself. Should I tell her I'm not ready? Should I try to get out of it? I wiped my sweaty palms on my blue jeans. Then I stood up and started to walk toward the front of the room. I could feel a nervous knot building up in my stomach. With note - card in hand, I began to speak. My words were quiet and shaky. My speech was about uniforms in school and if I agreed with them or not. As I went on, I could feel myself start to trip over my words. Then I started to laugh, which I always do when I'm nervous. I could hear other people in the room start to snicker. I smiled and looked down at my note - card and continued my speech. Afterward, I felt a big relief to get it over with. It wasn't perfect, but laughing at myself when I messed up helped me get through it without falling apart from my nervousness. Although not everyone reacts this way, laughing can help relieve tension in some situations. But always be careful not to laugh in situations where it's not appropriate. It's not good for you to have constant stress. Finding things to laugh about can be a good way to relieve stress. Laughing might not be the right behavior to get an A on your speech, but it did help me keep it together to make it through. Laughter is important to everyone. It's a great way to have fun with others and it keeps you happy. Laughing is a good way to relieve stress. Your relationships will grow stronger if you find things in common to laugh about. If you learn to laugh, you're sure to have a fun and happy life. I know I do.

Have you ever found yourself laughing heartily at something someone said, and then, as the laughter continued, you began laughing even harder, not at the joke itself, but at a person whose laugh was so unique and almost more humorous than the joke? Then, after this hilarious laughing episode, did you notice that your mood, which could have been the worst in the world just moments before, suddenly lifted? Laughter truly is the cure for a multitude of things, from being in a bad mood to crying due to sadness. It has the power to brighten the mood in a room and can effortlessly make any awkward moment vanish.  One bright @DATE1 day, @PERSON1 called me and sweetly asked if I wanted to long - board down to @PERSON2's and enjoy some lunch with her. Of course, I jumped at the chance because I'm always eager for my typical @PERSON2's order of a rich chocolate malt milkshake, along with some crispy croutons and creamy ranch dressing. I quickly jogged to her house just down the block, and then we long - boarded all the way to @PERSON2's in downtown @CAPS1.  On the way, I shared with @PERSON1 how my day had been going terribly so far and how desperately I needed to be cheered up. She confided that she was feeling the same way. When we finally arrived at @ORGANIZATION1's, we were both excited to get seated so we could catch up on each other's lives and dig into our meals. As we walked inside, we noticed how unusually crowded it was that day as we patiently waited for a table.  After getting settled, we observed an older couple sitting in the booth behind us, some kids from our school in the booth in front of us, and a man and a woman across the aisle. @PERSON1 ordered a delicious strawberry milkshake and a juicy burger with crispy fries, while I stuck to my usual order. After the friendly lady took our order and left, @PERSON1 and I started opening up about the reasons for our bad moods. She was in a funk because her friend @PERSON3 was not treating her right. I was down because my friend @CAPS2 was mad at me for something that never actually happened. We were both quite upset, and frankly, we were in no mood for laughter.  But then, all of a sudden, we heard what sounded like a strange mixture of a goose's honking and a donkey's braying. We turned around in surprise to find that it was a lady's laughter. I looked at @LOCATION1, and she looked at me, and we just started busting up laughing uncontrollably. This laughter went on for about @NUM1 minutes straight. We were both in disbelief that such a sound could come out of any human being's mouth, and it was probably the loudest laugh I've ever heard. We also found it incredibly funny that all of this was happening in a public place full of people, and the lady was unknowingly setting herself up to be the center of our amusement.  @PERSON1 and I continued to laugh at the lady's unique laugh, and somehow, it started to melt away our bad moods. @PERSON1 started smiling a little more, and as for me, I couldn't stop smiling and laughing. Laughter has an amazing and unusual way of putting people in a good mood or relieving them of their bad moods. Whether it's a normal little chuckle or an unnatural sound like the one we heard that day, laughter brings people together and is a great way to turn an awkward moment into a memorable one. Someone once wisely said, "laughter is the shortest distance between two people," and that person truly knew what they were talking about.

There are numerous reasons why laughter is an indispensable part of any relationship. In my view, one simply cannot be serious about everything all the time. Laughing is a wonderful way to let loose and relieve the stress that builds up in our daily lives. It also has the magical ability to lighten the mood and make people feel more at ease around each other. And the benefits of laughter extend far beyond just these aspects.  Being overly serious about every single thing is not always a good approach. We all need to have fun in our lives to stay happy. Surrounding ourselves with people who have the knack of making us laugh is always a surefire way to put ourselves in a good mood. Laughing is an excellent way to take the pressure off and not feel embarrassed about our actions or words. Having a relationship where one can freely laugh at things when they are funny is an absolute necessity.  For me, I've noticed that when I'm around people who can't laugh things off, I always feel like I have to be extremely cautious about what I say. It creates an uncomfortable and tense atmosphere. On the contrary, laughing is one of the best ways to just relax and be ourselves. Laughter also serves to lighten the mood and make people more comfortable around each other. If I don't feel like I can joke around and laugh with the people I'm with, I usually don't feel like I can truly be myself.  However, if one isn't initially comfortable with the people they are with, it might be a bit more challenging to start joking around. But eventually, if one lets themselves go and starts laughing, they will feel a closer connection to those people. Being happy and laughing with others creates a really strong bond between individuals. Making things into a joke is a common way many people use to keep themselves from getting embarrassed.  Usually, if you do something that others find funny but you don't, and they start laughing, you might feel uncomfortable. But if you start laughing along with them, it takes the pressure off you, and they are no longer laughing at you but rather laughing with you. In conclusion, there are countless things that laughing can do for us. It allows us to not have to be serious about everything, it takes the pressure off, and it relieves stress. Laughing is one of the best things people can do together to form a deep and meaningful connection. No matter what the situation, laughing can always put someone in a better frame of mind.

What is one of the most crucial aspects of a relationship? In my mind, laughter would undoubtedly be one of the most important parts. Take my relationship with @PERSON1 and @ORGANIZATION1, for example. We are constantly laughing; almost every moment we are together, someone is cracking a joke.  One memorable instance was when our varsity cheer squad went to @LOCATION2. We had a series of hilarious and chaotic events that night. Just as @PERSON1 was about to take a picture, a girl who worked there sneaked up behind us. The ever - mischievous @PERSON1 ran off without warning us. Instead, she decided to take the picture. For those of you who aren't familiar, it's when a bus stops at a stop light, and everyone (except the driver, of course) gets out and runs around the bus like wild people.
